If she hits and is dealt a card that doesn't match a card she already has in front of her, then the next player clockwise becomes the active player; if the card does match, then the round ends, she keeps one of these matching cards as penalty points, then everyone else discards their cards and a new round begins with each player being dealt a card.

If the active player forfeits, the round ends and she takes the lowest-valued card visible on the table as penalty points, then a new round begins. Penalty cards remain set aside, even if the deck is shuffled to continue play. If a player acquires more penalty points than the predetermined threshold, then the game ends and this player loses. (Alternatively, players can use coins to track scores between games, with the loser paying everyone one coin, paying her score in coins to the player with the lowest score, etc.)

There are many versions of Pairs from Cheapass Games. The base game play is identical, but the artwork (and artist) vary across the versions. Some include special game rules relevant to the theme of the deck. In general, you can find new/experimental/user-submitted rules at the Cheapass website, and many non-English versions of Pairs also include rules for additional games to play with this deck.
152237.name: Pairs

152238.name: The Absurd Superhero Name Generator: Part Deux
152238.description:
User Summary:

Two d100 lists for 10,000 oddball silly permutations of names.

152239.name: The Absurd Superhero Name Generator: Part Three
152239.description: User Summary: Two d100 lists for 10,000 oddball silly permutations of names for the 3rd time.

152240.name: A Week in the Life of a Lv. 1 Slime

rpg.24193: A Week in the Life of a Level 1 Slime

152240.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Level 1 Slime is a Solitaire Style Role Playing Game like no other.

Take the role of the simple slime, living and seeing the world through their eyes

• Run away from adventurers!

• Find true Slime love!

• Work the lowest of jobs for the Dark Lord!

• Live the life that only a slime would live!

Play the stories you want to tell, be the slimiest slime to slime among slimes!

Using an innovative candy-based system, the world, events, and even the severity of situations for your slimes are generated on the fly, all based on the kind of story that YOU want to tell!

152241.description:
Ultimate Werewolf is an interactive game of deduction for two teams: Villagers and Werewolves. The Villagers don't know who the Werewolves are, and the Werewolves are trying to remain undiscovered while they slowly eliminate the Villagers one at a time. A Moderator (who isn't on a team) runs the game.

Ultimate Werewolf takes place over a series of game days and nights. Each day, the players discuss who among them is a Werewolf, and vote out a player. Each night, the Werewolves choose a player to eliminate, while the Seer learns if one player is a Werewolf or not. The game is over when either all the Villagers or all the Werewolves are eliminated.

Ultimate Werewolf, a new edition of the award-winning, best-selling werewolf title from Bézier Games, has been reimagined to allow new players to quickly get up and running, with a larger box, totally rewritten and simplified rules, and a guide for the included roles. With all-new art and a great new card design, it's the perfect way to introduce groups of 7-30 people to Werewolf.
152241.name: Ultimate Werewolf

boardgameimplementation.162944: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition For Kickstarter

boardgamecompilation.162944: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition For Kickstarter

boardgamehonor.26783: 2014 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee

152242.description:
Ultimate Werewolf is an interactive game of deduction for two teams: Villagers and Werewolves. The Villagers don't know who the Werewolves are, and the Werewolves are trying to remain undiscovered while they slowly eliminate the Villagers one at a time. A Moderator (who isn't on a team) runs the game.

Ultimate Werewolf takes place over a series of game days and nights. Each day, the players discuss who among them is a Werewolf and vote out a player. Each night, the Werewolves choose a player to eliminate, while the Seer learns whether one player is a Werewolf or not. The game is over when either all the Villagers or all the Werewolves are eliminated.

Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition features all new artwork, a great new design, totally rewritten and more comprehensive rules, and an even better moderator scorepad. What's more, it supports more players than ever: 75 of your closest friends can converge on one or more villages using the components in this box.
152242.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition

boardgamecompilation.162944: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition For Kickstarter

152244.description:
Who are the most famous werewolves in the world? Better yet, how about the most famous *wolves* in the world? Ultimate Werewolf: Wolfpack has them all and in ways you'd never expect.

This expansion for Ultimate Werewolf has six new roles for your werewolfing fun. Think werewolves are too meek? That's because your villages have never had The Big Bad Wolf, who leads the werewolves to eliminate villagers twice as fast while he's in the game. On the opposite end of the spectrum is the terrifyingly-confused Fruit Brute, who is, of all things, a vegetarian. Elizabeth Taylor was pretty scary as Martha the crazy socialite, but every game you'll want to know who in your group is actually afraid of Virginia Woolf. And there's three more famous wolves, including one that totally coincidentally shares a name with one of the X-Men.

Ultimate Werewolf: Wolfpack is compatible with Ultimate Werewolf and Ultimate Werewolf Deluxe Edition
152244.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Wolfpack

152245.name: Cards vs Dice: Strategically Lucky
152245.description:
A very simple dice game. Match the dice with your cards. First person to get 7 "Lucky" cards, or get rid of all their cards first....WINS!

You start with passing out the cards evenly, then you need to match them to the dice. Either exactly, or a total. If you match the dice exactly, you gain a "Lucky" card. Either way you play those cards on the pile. If you can't match, you take the pile.

152246.name: Ray Gun Roulette
152246.description:
Disintegrate your friends!

Ray Gun Roulette is a high tech, high stakes game of bluffing for 2 to 10 players. Players are participating in this deadly game to acquire as many crystals as they can. Choose from an assortment of highly illegal firearms and blast away until you're either the last player alive or you possess all the crystals!

Each player starts with two primary shields (blue gems) and three crystals (the currency of the game). If a player runs out of crystals they have lost the game. A primary shield can absorb one blast from one of these lethal firearms, if a player gets hit with just one of these weapons unshielded, they will get disintegrated, and lose the game. The weapon cards contain all the information needed to use them.

Each weapon, in addition to the illustration and weapon name, have a number of features,
-Kill-o-watt rating: the power rating of the weapon, if both players are targeting each other, the higher kill-o-watt weapon wins and damages their target.
-Deflector shield rating: some weapons have a built-in deflector shield. It can deflect a shot coming from a player that you are not targeting this round. If the kill-o-watt rating is less than or equal to the deflector shield rating (remember to multiply the deflector rating by 1,000 before comparing) the shot has no effect. Otherwise the shot goes through and can be absorbed by a primary shield or disintegrate the player.
-Special ability: each weapon has a unique special ability. Some of these can be particularly game-changing and devastating. Any player may negate the special ability of a weapon at the cost of one crystal (thrown into the pot for the current round), once per round, immediately after the effect would have taken place.

A round of Ray Gun Roulette has a number of phases,
-Choose weapons, dealer deals each player 3 cards, they choose one and discard the rest.
-Ante up!, each player places a crystal in the pot.
-Aim, players pick a target, making a "gun" hand pointing at them. This stage is when the bluffing really takes place, feel free to switch targets, intimidate, trash talk, and fold at any time.
-Last chance, Dealer declares "Last chance to fold, targets locked!". From this point on players cannot switch targets. Players may not fold once this phase has ended.
Fire!, all together players call out "3, 2, 1, FIRE!" and flip over their cards, revealing what weapons they were using.
-Determine winners, Determining the winner is simple; if you lost a primary shield this round or were disintegrated, you lost. Otherwise the player has won and will split the pot with the other winners. crystals that cannot be split evenly between the winners remain in the pot for the next round.
-Play continues until either one player has all the crystals or is the only one alive.

boardgamehonor.25002: 2013 Årets Spel Best Family Game Winner

152247.name: Quizmysteriet
152247.description:
In Quizmysteriet your whole family gets to use both cunning and general knowledge to figure out a mysterious theft that a famous person has committed. Is it Little Red Riding Hood that has stolen an egg-roll and is hiding in New York? Or is it Christopher Columbus that has taken a hammer-head shark and is now hiding out in the Sahara desert?
The player that first unravels the mystery will be crowned the city's new master-detective!

The players will move about the city, looking for clues as to WHO did the crime, WHAT they stole and WHERE the thief is hiding. The game has been compared to a mixture of Cops 'n' Robbers, Clue and a trivia-game.

When playing, the players roll the dice and then move about the board, trying to get to the different clue-squares (3 different color-coded clues to each part of the answer exists) where they get a clue as to who did the deed, what they stole or where they are hiding and they also get a clue-chip. These chips can be used to get help from the citys former master-detective if the player has a hard time in figuring out the clues.
When the player thinks he or she has the correct answer they move to the police-station as quickly as possible and once there they get to write down their guesses. If they have guessed correctly they win the game, otherwise they are out of the game.

152248.description:
The chef that makes the most dishes wins!

Tabula Pasta is a game where the players are all chefs working at a small Italian restaurant. They are trying to out do each other by getting the most satisfied customers. Each customer's order is determined by rolling three special dice (meat, pasta, and sauce). The chefs must race against each other to fulfil the orders using the cards in their hand, the deck, and the pantry. The chef with the most satisfied customers by the end of the game is the winner!

The board game is a table, set for four persons. To begin the game you place a meeple (patron) in each chair. Determine each patron's order by rolling their own set of special dice, one each of a sauce, meat, and pasta die. The players (chefs) then have to match the patron's order by drawing cards from the grocery delivery (deck) or the pantry (three piles of discarded cards, shared by everyone, that haven't been used to fill an order). Once an order has been filled the player shows everyone their match, moves the patron next to them to keep score, places the used cards in the bus bin (discard pile, you can never dig from the trash to complete an order, that's gross!), and finally seats a new patron (if any are left) and rolls a new order for them. Play continues until everyone has been served.

In addition to the six types of pasta, meat, and sauce cards there are also wild cards and secret ingredient cards (a pasta, meat, or sauce that counts as any other type, but you can only use one to fill an order). There are variations for faster games: using less patrons and/or removing the meat cards and dice (light lunch).
152248.name: Tabula Pasta

152250.name: Ghost Hunter 13: The Tile Game
152250.description:
Japanese analog game developer Group SNE makes their popular horror themed tabletop RPG "Ghost Hunter" into a fine co-op tile laying board game.

In this newly introduced rendition of the game, as a team, players explore a mysterious mansion to complete several missions ( long forgotten artifacts, monsters hard to beat, mysteries about the mansion, etc etc... ) which bundled scenarios task them. Players can move their chosen heroes ( each one gets uniquely powered and equipped ) up to two tiles. If there's no tile to move in, you may draw　as many tiles as you need from a stock for placement.

Tile by tile, the mansion would gradually reveal itself to players. On their explorations, your heroes sustain mental/physical damages ( your characters might go mad or die if it's too much to bear ), fight off some deadly monsters, and discover powerful artifacts to help your team keep on.

152251.name: Thousand Suns: Character Sheet
152251.description: User Summary: The two-page character sheet from the rules.

152252.name: On the Non-Player Character
152252.description:
from the back of the book

A compiled volume of information for players of Classic Fantasy Role-Playing games, Including: encounter procedures; non-player character design; objective resolution to social encounters; social combat; argumentation procedures; and advice on managing players.

152253.name: Devil Gut Rock
152253.description:
PDF Description:

Under a harsh blue sky lies a massive red sandstone rock. Venting volcanic vapor, it has the shape and color of a giant mound of steaming guts spilled onto the badlands.

Over several months the town of Longfarm has had cases of bloodless livestock dead in pasture and now several villagers have gone missing recently. Canine and hu- manoid tracks lead towards the wasteland and Devil Gut Rock.

152254.name: The Graveyard
152254.description:
User summary:

An adventure for characters of level 4-5. Explore a graveyard and the catacombs.

152255.name: Holy Sword
152255.description:
User summary:

An dungeon adventure aimed at paladins to recover a holy sword.

152256.name: The Oracle of Pagebrin
152256.description:
PDF Description:

Legends tell about a magical place in a mountain range near the coast that houses the all-powerful Oracle of Pagebrin. Many adventurers have set forth with promises of untold riches and assurances that the oracle does not serve the darkness. Wary adventurers however reflect upon the implied fact that the oracle does not serve the light either...

152257.name: One Page Dungeon
152257.description:
PDF Description:

The "ancients" left behind a great treasure, perhaps the greatest treasure of all time, but they left it guarded by a clever devious trap system. Only three people have a chance to get that treasure.

152258.name: The River of Stars
152258.description:
User summary:

Explore a ruined palace built over an ancient underground complex and explore its true nature.

152260.name: Run Robot Red!
152260.description:
From Introduction:

This is Run, Robot Red!, a mad mechanized world of robots on the run. You play one of these bots, hoping to uncover a way to escape the Widenet YT starship and find your way to freedom. To discover and open this mysterious portal of liberty, you must
explore the ship’s vast mysteries, uncover its past, and perhaps even discover some secrets you never knew you had. While looking for this escape, you quickly find yourself dodging the ship’s security systems, passing through code doors, recruiting other robots to join your cause, and escaping the evil tyranny of Cel Tron Stroma!

152261.name: Starvation
152261.description:
It is the year 2056, not much is left of mankind. A nuclear war destroyed all civilisations on earth. The survivors are in desperate need of food. For food, even radiated, means at least short-term survival. Can your group of survivors outlive the other groups in the struggle for food and survival?

Starvation is a quick boardgame that can be played with 2 to 5 players. Although the rules are simple the tactics are not.

The game starts with a board with scattered food tokens. At the start all players take turn placing their survivor pieces on the board. After this the game starts.
Each player first has to choose use up food to let his pieces survive or to give up his pieces. After that he is allowed to let his pieces move, taking with him a limited amount of food. The player with the last survivor on the board wins.

152262.name: Second World War at Sea: Torpedo Boats

boardgameaccessory.31378: Second World War at Sea: Arctic Convoy

152262.description:
Between 1923 and 1945, the German Navy built a series of small destroyers called “torpedo boats.” They served as escorts, but often sailed with the cruisers and battleships in the role of fleet destroyers. A number of them appear in Arctic Convoy and Bismarck, on the small square pieces we use for minor warships.

Torpedo Boats is a set of 70 “long” pieces portraying every German torpedo boat that saw service in World War II, plus some that weren’t completed like the big 1941 Type boats. The pieces themselves are made with the same scorchless technology as our ultra-thick ones, but are about the same thickness as The Kaiser’s Navy (to make them blend in easier with Arctic Convoy and Bismarck) with no scorching or ash residue. All seven classes of torpedo boats built by the Germans are represented.


These are larger alternative pieces, to replace the smaller pieces supplied with the game.

rpg.4996: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)

152263.name: Secrets of the Empire
152263.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Show me a man who has no secrets, and I will show you either a corpse or a terrible threat to the status quo." -Otomo Banu

Consumed with their own affairs and agendas, the Great Clans of Rokugan rarely pay attention to the goings on of the other groups that share the Empire with them. The Minor Clans, ronin, the Brotherhood of Shinsei, and even the Imperial families themselves are often overlooked in the schemes of the Great Clans, and ofter to the detriment of those who fail to take them into account.

Secrets of the Empire presents, in great detail, information concerning these groups, including an exhaustive list of Rokugan's Minor Clans, the polotical intrigue of the Imperial families, and much more detail on the workings of the Empire's wave men and the ubiquitous Brotherhood of Shinsei, not to mention the mysterious Spirit Realms that lay just beyone the reach of the mortal world.

In this book you will find:

Ancestors for each of the groups mentioned above.
The history and culture of each of Rokugan's many Minor Clans.
The secrets of the Hantei, Otomo, Seppun, Miya, Toturi, and Iweko families.
Information on many sects and practices of the Brotherhood of Shinsei.

152264.name: Leningrad 1941:  The Embattled City
152264.description:
A division to army level game having a map from Pskov up to Leningrad (but not Finland or Finns) and east over to strategic Tichvin. 20mis/32kms per hex, 11 10-day turns. Terrain is simplified: it was all bad up there, off the roads. :)

Game system uses Disruption and Entrenchable (flip-side) infantry/rifle units, to simulate momentum of advance and/or positional inertia.

Includes special rules for the Red Banner Baltic Fleet and Marines, railway guns, Red Air Force 7th Fighter (interceptor) Aviation Korps, optional reinforcements (historically used), etc.

Free, to print off, assemble, and play.

152265.name: Clock Blockers
152265.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Clock Blockers is about time travelers using their machine for their own fun and profit rather than worrying about stepping on butterflies. Maybe they put right what once went wrong. Or they decide to sink Noah's Ark and corner the market on giraffes.

152266.name: Perhaps She'll Die
152266.description:
There was an old Lady who swallowed a fly... This trick-taking game is themed on the popular children’s song. The object is to take tricks by playing the highest-ranked animal card. Problem is, when an animal card is played, its rank changes and usually for the worse.

Before each round, ranking cards are placed on the table in a row in order of rank: fly, spider, bird, cat, dog, goat, cow, horse. The fly is the lowest ranked at the start, and the horse is the highest. The animal cards are shuffled and dealt. The start player plays a card, and the corresponding card in the rank row is shifted down one space. If an animal is already the lowest ranked animal, it is moved to the furthest space on the right and becomes the highest ranked animal.

Play proceeds clockwise. In turn, each player plays a card. A player must follow suit if possible, otherwise he may play any card. Each played card causes the corresponding card in the rank row to shift down as described above.

After everyone has played, the player whose card matches the currently highest ranked animal wins the trick (regardless of suit). If two or more players have played the same ‘winning’ card, the player who played first wins the trick.

This is a 3-4 player game. Partnership rules are included as well.

152267.name: Where Mammoths Dare Not Tread
152267.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 7–11.

Despite several promising developments on the front lines, it’s increasingly clear to the Pathfinder Society that fighting its way across the entire Worldwound would prove far more costly than approaching the Sky Citadel Jormurdun from the west. What it might gain in ease of use, the society lacks in an established basecamp, so the PCs must travel to the Realm of the Mammoth Lords to win over the locals and secure a beachhead—all without falling prey to the area’s powerful megafauna, savage demons, and relentless barbarian tribes.

152268.name: Library of the Lion
152268.description:
Publisher Blurb

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–5.

Few societies have so vaunted a tradition of leading crusades as Taldor, yet the constant revisions to its history by scheming factions leaves the truth obscured by countless acts of political modifications. Even the lauded Kitharodian Academy’s texts are riddled with these changes, so when a secretive ally approaches the Pathfinder Society with information about a hidden archive that contains the unaltered histories, the Pathfinders plan a daring infiltration to recover the secrets of Taldor’s past victories so that Mendev might benefit from the discovery.

Content in "Library of the Lion" also contributes directly to the ongoing storylines of the Cheliax, Grand Lodge, and Taldor factions.

152269.name: Hideous Creatures: Shoggoth
152269.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Infinitely plastic and ductile — slaves of suggestion, builders of cities — more and more sullen … intelligent … amphibious … and imitative!” If something can take any shape, what is its true nature? Are the shoggoths slave machines or biotech Singularity? Are they one or many? Tekeli-li!

152270.name: Chain Bridge
152270.description:
From the introduction

A small bridge has been set up here to cross the river tranquilly flowing along through the forest. While other architects elsewhere would have set up a much simpler wooden bridge elsewhere for such a small dirt path through a forest the architect of this bridge decided otherwise. The regular spring flood would tear away a mere wooden bridge with ease time and again, especially once driftwood gets caught against it.

For this very reason the bridge's builder decided to set up a chain bridge. It's massive stone pillars have withstood every flood so far and although the chains have become rusty they have not broken yet either. Only the wooden planks laid down on the chains have to be replaced every once in a while when the bridge warden is surprised by a flood and has no time to remove them.

152271.name: Assembly Line
152271.description:
From the introduction

This small part of an automated assembly line is in turn only a small part of a much larger factory hall. Still, the conveyor system and the industrial robots surrounding it take up a considerable amount of floor space. Much of what little space remains between the machinery is currently taken up by crates. These crates together with the only partially set up safety fences hint at the fact that the setup of this particular assembly line is not entirely finished yet.

152272.name: Farmhouse
152272.description:
From the introduction

A small farmhouse, built from the logs of the largest trees that have grown here, lies in the middle of a large clearing. Meadows for the few animals lie to the one side and fields of wheat to the other. A cart is parked behind the house and in preparation for the coming winter stacks of fire wood have been set up next to it. Soon it will be time to harvest the fields. Some other odd jobs remain to be done before winter arrives as well. Among other things a few of the wooden shingles, loosed by wind and weather, have to be replaced to make sure the inside of the log house remains warm and comfortable during the cold season. A small farmhouse, built from the logs of the largest trees that have grown here, lies in the middle of a large clearing. Meadows for the few animals lie to the one side and fields of wheat to the other. A cart is parked behind the house and in preparation for the coming winter stacks of fire wood have been set up next to it. Soon it will be time to harvest the fields. Some other odd jobs remain to be done before winter arrives as well. Among other things a few of the wooden shingles, loosed by wind and weather, have to be replaced to make sure the inside of the log house remains warm and comfortable during the cold season.

152273.name: Stilt Houses
152273.description:
From the introduction

A small village lies just off the shore of this shallow lake. The few wooden houses on their stilts are connected by wooden walkways constructed in a similar manner. The open construction of the houses hints on a quite moderate or even warm climate all year around while the construction high stilts suggests that the water level of the shallow lake could on occasion rise quite a bit.

While most of the inhabitants make a living as fishermen and probably travel across the lake overgrown by water lilies a single walkway connects the small settlement with the dry land, probably to allow the occasional trader access to the village or maybe to harvest fruit from the trees growing along the shore.

152274.name: Mine Entry
152274.description:
From the introduction

Often enough the entrance to a mine is nothing more than a dark hole in a cliff face or the ground. In this case the miners have made more of an effort. A simple house, not much more than a wooden framework filled in with stones and mortar from the depths of the mountain covered with a wood shingle roof, has been set up around the entrance to the mine. A well trodden path leads down from the mountain slope past the stumps of countless trees cut down to serve as shoring timbers in the mine shafts. Evidently the mine has been around for quite a while.

152275.name: Thorn & Rose
152275.description:
In this two-player card game, one person takes on the role of the Hero while the other takes on the role of the Witch. The Hero and the Witch must memorize the layout of the "Cursed Wood" (a 4x4 grid of cards) and then flip over the cards so no one knows what they are. From there, the Hero (using only their memory), must traverse the "Cursed Wood" by flipping over cards one at a time. If the Hero finds 5 Blood Roses, they succeed in their quest! If they find 5 Frights, the Hero fails!

Magic and mayhem add complication to the Hero's quest! The Witch can shift the cards and change the layout of the "Cursed Wood" each time the Hero finds a Fright!

152276.name: MicroSport Soccer
152276.description:
MicroSport Soccer is a fast-playing finger-flicking action game played with a portable board and small coin.

The basic game revolves around players taking turns flicking the coin in an attempt to land it on the goal. Individual player zones govern ball possession, while additional rules cover passing, turnovers, throw-ins, and goal kicks. The adjustable size of each team's player zones and goals allows amateurs to compete with experts.

152277.description:
A previously unpublished expansion for the ASL Starter Kits, utilizing boards and countermixes for ASLSK 2 and 3. Included as an insert to Tactical Wargamer's Journal, Issue 3.

Sweeping the Doorstep is a two-player scenario depicting the fighting at Carpiquet in July 1944. The scenario was designed as part of the Battles of Carpiquet (q.v.) contest but was not released with those scenarios as it was the only ASLSK scenario in the contest. In addition to the scenario, playtest notes and historical articles are included.

Tactical Wargamer's Journal (ISSN 1918-9729), published on a non-regular schedule, covers topics of interest on all aspects of the world of commercial tactical wargaming, with its focus set on warfare at the man-to-man, squad and platoon level in the 20th Century and contemporary era. Tactical Wargamer's Journal (TWJ) places emphasis on both military history and the history of tactical level gaming itself.

Issue 3 focuses on the history of the 21st Army Group in Northwest Europe and depictions of the Commonwealth Armies in that theatre in tactical-level wargames.
152277.name: Sweeping the Doorstep

152278.name: Rock City
152278.description:
Rock city is a dice placement game in which players command their own band and compete to develop and present the best songs during the three festivals of this great city.

Before each of the festivals, players have 6 rounds of action. In each round, players roll 3 dices each, and during his turn he can perform one action. To perform the action, the player will use 1, 2 or 3 dices. The round goes on until no player has any action left (i.e. dices).

The actions vary between perform in underground bars, practice your musics, write new lyrics, buy materials at the music shop, publish a sample CD or just perform at the Casino to get some extra cash. Each of those spaces needs a different combination between quantity of dices and the sum of them.

Once players have written one or more lyrics, they are ready to try to get the best melody possible for that tune!

The winner of the game is the player with most points, that will be earned by playing musics during the shows. You can also earn points by adding a nice production value to your show or having some fancy different instruments on your band.

152279.name: Civicus
152279.description:
Your humble tribe has struggled generation after generation for mere subsistence. After eons of hunting and gathering, feasts and famine, war and peace, your people have finally entered an age of innovation.

With the advent of horticulture, your tribe has settled into a sedentary way of life and through this change, idle minds have begun to develop new ways of understanding and manipulating the world around them. Great advancements are being made in subsistence, government, technology, culture, commerce, diplomacy, and warfare.

This sea change has inspired a need for guidance and through careful consideration your people have elected you to lead them into the future.

Civicus is a civilization themed, tile placement and area control game in which players compete for territories, resources and exotic goods. These essential elements of the game are earned, maintained, and developed through sound logic, thoughtful tile placement, and strategic planning.

Each round the players will take turns placing new terrain tiles. Strategic tile placement is crucial for a player’s success, as this aspect of the game determines the geographical matrix for game play and dictates resource and action point generation. Resources and action points are required for nearly every aspect of the game, including settlement and temple construction, attribute development, and wealth generation.

Throughout four ages, the players will compete for territory control, by building and developing settlements. In turn, these territories will provide the players with the raw materials required for cultivating a great and powerful nation. The greatness of your nation is determined, in part, by a preset scoring system which focuses heavily on settlement construction, exotic good control, as well as, fortune and fame.

The nation with the most victory points at the end of the fourth age wins!
[Crowds cheer… fireworks erupt… enemies conspire]

152281.name: Crumbling Epoch
152281.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The gods have left, magic has been reinvented when the old powers burned out, and humanity has survived multiple extinction-level events. There are five classes, including humans touched by the divine, and weak-blooded vampires called Thirsters. Fighters can focus on weapons and armor, or reflexes and style. Wizards use their life energy to fuel their potent magic. Anyone can use armor and weapons in this dangerous world.

This simple game has 12 pages of rules, and the rest is support. There are no attributes, one saving throw roll, and damage-reducing armor–a whole new flavor. Here you will find all you need to run a dungeon crawl without a DM, all on a 2 page spread, for 2 settings! Quick-start tools for a campaign world include a region generator, a religion generator, and a unique monster builder. Several examples of play help grasp the new rhythm of the rules. Finally, each class in the book comes with a Pocket Mod character sheet, so a quick-start game has sheets for the players with rule summaries and class-specific information!

Other fine writers contributed to this game. The appendices include three classes to allow play in Jack Shear’s Devilmount, along with his essay explaining Lumpen-Ones. An adapted spellbook from Wampus Country, based on Erik Jensen’s work, expands what spells wizards can find.

Crumbling Epoch can be played on its own, but it is also compatible with Dungeons and Dragons B/X monster stat blocks and treasure. The game plays very differently, but it can allow you to re-use those old modules and have a completely new game experience.

152282.name: Paradise Fallen: Upgraded Island Cards
152282.description:
A Kickstarter stretch goal, this upgrade made all Nine Island Locations Cards thick, chunky, linen covered cardboard (2mm thick punchboard) that is similar in size and thickness to the Eminent Domain Starting Planet Cards.

Likely to be available for purchase at a later date

152284.name: Reise um die Erde: ein humoristisches geographisches Gesellschaftsspiel
152284.description:
The first game published by the Otto Maier Verlag, later to be known as Ravensburger Spieleverlag.

The game was inspired by Jules Verne's "Around the World in Eighty Days". The players travel around the board rolling dice to get to the field with the number 80 accomplishing their travel around the world, using money to overcome any troubles along the way.

152286.description:
Demigods Evolution is a skirmish-style board game for 2 or 4 players in which they take the roles of demigods, commanding armies of heroes to prove supremacy over others and ascend as the new God of War. As a demigod, a player initially has access to 24 heroes from which he can choose his army. With his choice he then faces his opponent(s) on sacred battleground.

There are different game modes regarding picking heroes (chieftain, random, mirror, free pick mode), and regarding conditions on which victory is achieved (skirmish, tactics). It is the game that relies heavy on tactics, that is fairly simple to learn but hard to master and that has a great replayability.

In time of Chaos, the God of War was supreme ruler over all other gods. But Time of Peace came, and lasted so long that God of War started to lose his power. He grew weaker as the years went by and was pushed to the side by other gods. When his power faded so much that he felt that the end was near he gave the task to his four sons, the demigods, to try to prove themselves as best commanders in the field of battle. The one who can emerge victorious should become the new God of War and bring back the former glory to their name.

Gather your heroes, challenge your friends, become the God of War!
152286.name: Demigods Evolution

152287.name: Dueling Eagles: Aerial Combat over Malta
152287.description:
Published as Spel!enkaart #0013 in Spel! 17.2 December 2013.
Postcard game.

4 turn game. The Italian player wins when succeeding in bombing his target with the BR-20M or by eliminating one the English planes without losing one of his own. The British player wins when the target is still on the map or when he succeeds in eliminating more than one Italian plane.
The game ends sooner when either British or Italian player loses al his planes before the 4th turn.

An additional standard card deck is needed to play.

152288.name: Snoopy wensdromen-spel
152288.description:
In this game Snoopy has four different wishes: becoming a top pilot, top baseball player, top dog or famous writer. (Each of the cards is 4 times in the game.) All players (2-8) try to collect the five cards that are part of the same wish.

You can collect by walking around on the board or owing to a 'menu-card'. The first player who collects his 5 cards is the winner.

152289.name: Stars und Sternchen
152289.description:
User summary

The fourth supplement for SpacePirates, this booklet comes in the guise of tabloid papers and yellow press, reporting about teen idols and power-hungry media corporations. It includes an adventure and many hooks and seeds.

Publisher blurb:

In diesem Themenheft geht es um die Populärkultur, die glitzernden Sternchen der Boulevardpresse; um die Teenie-Idole, die von machthungrigen Medienunternehmen gnadenlos ausgenutzt werden; um all die (Möchtegern-)Typen, die sich in der überbordenden und allgegenwärtigen Medienlandschaft tummeln und natürlich auch um die skrupellosen Medienkon­zerne und Filmindustrie selbst.

Stars und Sternchen ist das vierte Themenheft zum SpacePirates-Rollenspiel, diesmal in ungewöhnlichem Layout. Es soll den typischen Zeitungs- und Klatschblatt-Flair nachahmen, da es genau die Inhalte solcher Publikationen enthält. Taucht in die Welt der SpacePirates-Promis ab und lernt die glitzernde Populärkultur von SpacePirates kennen. Aber keine Angst: Neben Klatsch, Tratsch und Schlagzeilen zu Medienkonzernen, Promis und angesagten Locations gibt es in diesem Themenheft natürlich auch nützliche Hintergrundinformationen, Abenteuerideen und ein sofort spielbares Abenteuer. Nun wünsche ich euch viel Spaß mit Stars und Sternchen!

Inhalt


Schlagzeilen
Seite 1
Letzte Seite

Starnet
Beliebte Starnetsendungen

Konzerne
Promis
Aristokratie
Wagonische Königsfamilie
Streifianische Fürstenfamilie

Das System der Träume
Sandalien
Der rote Planet
Planet Bollywood
Planet Hollywood
Serius 80
Avantgardia
Der Stummfilm-Planet
Die SdT-Station oder: „Die Mimen-Mission“
Weitere Orte
1. Interplanetarer Golfplatz
Saloniki

Ausrüstung



Abenteuer



Abenteuerideen
Mögliche Aufträge auf der Mimen-Mission
Wagonian Wedding

152290.name: Orðabelgur
152290.description:
Orðabelgur is intended for 2-6 participants and suits people of all ages. This game encourages players to listen and thing, be merry and be informed. The game offers contemplation, consideration, word-play and jest, and participants play with the Icelandic language in new ways. The vocabulary in the game covers a great number of Icelandic words, both old and new. The aim of the game is to collect five words in a sack by answering questions from five categories according to certain rules.

The questions are on cards, each indicating which category it belongs to. Two questions of different difficulty levels are on each card, making the game a good fit for a family. A word-shark directs the game, and reads our questions and possible answers and awards players with words for their word-sack when they have been earned.

152291.name: Playout: The Game
152291.description:
Playout: The Game™ makes fitness fun for people of all ages and fitness abilities. Turn bodyweight exercise into a fun competition with over 10 unique games and infinite exercise combinations, all using a single deck of cards. Why workout when you can PLAYOUT!


Play alone or with friends
No additional equipment needed!
Full body fitness in 10 minutes of fun!


Playout: The Game™ is an exercise card game that makes fitness fun through social play, competition, variety, and adaptability. With Playout, you can get fit while having fun, anywhere, anytime.

30 BODYWEIGHT EXERCISE CARDS - 10 Upper, 10 Core, 10 Lower - A comprehensive full body calisthenic routine for all fitness levels. Each card features an individual exercise and includes direction and tips on how to perform the excercise. In addition, each card includes three rep counts to vary the difficulty as well as a point value for completing the reps for the exercise.

12 WILDCARDS - Challenges to increase the difficulty and variability of the exercises by adding reps, incorporating new motions or body positions, slowing down motions, or adding new exercises. Depending on the game played, the Wild (i.e. Joker) cards include directions for each of the difficulty levels that can be applied to an Exercise card to make it more difficult. Additional points are awarded for completing the Joker cards.


8 MINIGAMES - Intensely fun competitions that push you to the limit. When these cards are encountered, a mini game occurs that really ratchets up the game. 10 or 20 additional points can be earned for both participating and winning the minigame.


Stretch, Warm-Up, Cool-Down, Rule, and Information Cards

GAMES

The Playout deck can either used as an activity to facilitate an exercise routine, or it can be used to play several games. These games can be played as individual players or team vs. team:
Playout Pro (High Intensity)
The 6 Minute Playout (Moderate/High Intensity)
Playout Rummy (Low/Moderate Intensity) - Be the first to get rid of all you cards by making sets. From each set made, choose an exercise for yourself and opponents to perform. Award points to those who complete the exercises.
Playout Grand Prix
Playout All-Star





SCORING

In general, scoring works as follows:
Exercise Card:
Full reps - 10 points + WildCard value
At least half the rep = WildCard value
Less then half the reps = no points

MiniGame Card:
Qualify = 10 points
Winner = 20 points






The player (or team, if playing in teams) with the most points at the end of a particular game (or set of games in the case of a multi-game competition) is the winner.

152292.name: Fightback
152292.description:
Thugs have kidnapped your sister but they’ve picked on the wrong guy. It’s time to Fightback! From the award-winning developer Ninja Theory comes a new standard in mobile fighters. Stunning visuals, unique controls, and a vibrant design come together to bring you the pinnacle of mobile fighting games.

Source: The Publisher Website.

152293.name: Essential Collection
152293.description:
User summary:
This bundle contains all 5 books of the horizon series in one soft cardboard slipcase/wrapper:
Grimm
Mechamorphosis
Redline
Spellslinger
Virtual

152303.name: The Apple Orchard Game
152303.description:
Game found in the Postman Pat Annual for 1998.

A simple game for pre-school children.

Each player has a tree with 20 apples on it. In your turn, a coin is flipped and the following happens:
Heads - Pick 1 apple (cover an apple with a small piece of card or similar)
Tails - Pick 2 apples (and cover as before).

The winner is the first player to cover every apple on their tree.

152304.name: Games Orbit (Spiel 2013 Special Issue)
152304.description: Special Spiel 2013 issue of Games Orbit magazine.

152305.description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1995.

Children are encouraged to take a walk through Greendale village and meet some of their favourite characters.

Simple roll and move game for pre-school children. Players must obey instructions if they land on a pink space. The first to reach space Z, wins.
152305.name: The Alphabet Game

152306.description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1994.

A simple roll and move game for pre-school children. The Greendale policeman is having a busy day. Each player rolls the die and moves, obeying instructions when they land on a beige space. The first to get to the end of PC Selby's day (space 49), wins.
152306.name: On Patrol with PC Selby

152307.name: Cover the Picture
152307.description:
Game featured in the Postman Pat Annual for 1994.

Simple game for pre-school children.

Each player uses one of the two pictures. The pictures are divided in to 10 oblong segments. These are numbered from one to four. In a turn, the player rolls the die and if he rolls a 1, 2, 3, or 4, he covers one segment with that number (use a piece of card or similar to mark that the segment has been rolled). If a 5 is rolled on the die, the player must uncover one of the segments. If a 6 is rolled, the player can cover two segments of his choice.

First player to cover all 10 segments, wins.

152308.description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1994.

A simple game for pre-school children.

Players roll a die to move along the trach to the top of the hill, where they can have a picnic with Postman Pat. Should a player land on a rabbit hole, they go down to the other end of the hole. Should they land on a short-cut, they can move nearer the top of the hill. The first to get there, wins.
152308.name: Top of the Hill

152309.description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1993.

A simple roll and move game for pre-school children.

Players must get from Sam Waldron's house to Pat's house for tea. Move according to your die roll and obey any light brown spaces you land on. First to get to the end of the route, wins.
152309.name: Go with Sam

152310.description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1993.

A simple roll and move game for pre-school children.

Players are in an air race over Greendale. Move according to your die roll. If you land on the light blue spaces, you must obey the instructions. First to space 35, wins.
152310.name: Balloon Race

152311.name: Cover the Squares
152311.description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1993.

Two players are required. Each gets a picture board featuring 6 characters from the Postman Pat stories. In your turn, roll a die. Using playing cards as 'markers', you cover the picture that matches your roll on the die. If you roll the same number twice, you miss a turn. First to cover all six characters on their picture board, wins.

152312.name: 12-21-12: Fire & Ice
152312.description:
12-21-12 the game where you spend the last day of the earth however you like. Be it rape, pedophilia, murder, arson, whatever you want! Afterall, there aren't any consequences during the last day!

This micro-expansion gives you the ability to kill off the other players to make sure your final day is better than theirs!

152313.name: The Bible Game
152313.description:
The Bible Game is a trivia game based off the Bible. There are 4000 questions and Answers with Bible references. There is also seven different categories;

1. Life of Christ.
2. New Testament.
3. Old Testament.
4. W.W.W. Who, Where, or Woman.
5. Quotes.
6. Alpha and Omega.
7. General Knowledge.

152314.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Money is honest. Credits may be cold, uncaring, heartless abstractions, but they offer an unavoidable truth: The more, the better." –Iain Stirling

The network lies before you; which path will you take? Focusing primarily on the interests of Jinteki and three new Criminal runners, Honor and Profit is a deluxe expansion for Android: Netrunner - The Card Game. Its 165 new cards (three copies each of fifty-five different cards) feature a dizzying array of new tricks and traps, events to alter the tempo of the game, new psi talents, and six new identity cards that engender the exploration of all-new deck-building strategies. Additionally, fans of every faction will discover plenty to love among the expansion's neutral ambushes, ice, ops, AI, and connections.
152314.name: Android: Netrunner – Honor and Profit

152315.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 175 - Mar 1990)
152315.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #175
March 1990

Cover art by unidentified artist (credited as "Squiggle").

152317.name: Hate Plus
152317.description:
Let's spend the next three real-time days together uncovering the mystery of year zero on the Mugunghwa, with the help of a spunky/more-than-slightly-traumatized AI sidekick!

A sequel to Analogue: A Hate Story that tells a whole new hate story of its own. Analogue players can pick up where their finished save files left off, and new players can start fresh in Hate Plus.

A dark visual novel about transhumanism, cosplay, cake-baking, and the slow patriarchal erosion of freedoms taken for granted.

♡ Please, look forward to your hateful days~! ♡

Source: The Game Website.

152318.description:
Game description from the publisher:

A new peril erupts in the realm with The Firelands expansion for Talisman (revised 4th edition). The legendary Ifrit have returned to exact fiery vengeance on the land of Talisman. The Ifrit's inferno will char the land, burning away players' resources and setting entire regions ablaze. Players must race to battle this terrible threat since only the Crown of Command can truly extinguish the Ifrit's flames. Only the greatest of heroes will rise from the flames to complete the quest across The Firelands.

Talisman: The Firelands includes four new characters: the Dervish, the Warlord, the Nomad, and the Jin Blooded. New terrain cards reshape the land in the wake of the Ifrit's destruction, and three new alternative ending cards offer players different ways to engage in the endgame.
152318.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Firelands Expansion

152319.description:
Game description by the publisher:

Journey through the realm of Talisman on your quest for the Crown of Command but beware the fiery Pyrochanter, fearsome Titan Wraith, and other Nether Deck enemies that seek to thwart your plans in The Nether Realm expansion.

The Nether Realm — designed by Jon New, the man behind the Talisman-dedicated fansite Talisman Island — offers three new alternative endings for Talisman, along with new Nether cards. Fate also plays a part in this expansion, helping against some of the larger foes found in the Nether deck, but it could also prove to be your downfall.
152319.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Nether Realm Expansion

152320.name: RAEDWALD
152320.description:
publisher blurb

Rædwald is a world where the bond of the warband, the oath of loyalty between warrior and king, your word, your honour and your status means everything. It is a world where family, community, and the king's laws are a shield against misfortune.

Unfortunately for the characters the world of Rædwald is one in which they have none of these things. Instead, they are outsiders: Wolfshead outlaws. Tired of merely surviving they take coin from a lord, and now serve as his Wolfpack, a band of ruthless, expendable outlaw scum.

REQUIRES HEROES & OTHER WORLDS RULEBOOK TO PLAY!

152321.name: Fortress of the Witch King

videogameversion.228007: North American Apple II 5 1/4" Disk edition

152321.description:
From the back of the box:

Only the fearless and the brave dare enter the Fortress of the Witch King.

For once you enter you are committed to the task of finding and slaying the Witch King and freeing the inhabitants of the land. Treasures and riches are yours if you triumph.

As you thrust forward on your quest for the orb, scepter and crown, Beware! Outnumbered by the arch ruler's followers, you and your small band of brave scouts face constant peril.

Use a magic spell to teleport you out of danger... or into a band of the Witch King's warriors, trolls, or deadliest of all... the vicious hacker! Be on constant guard for roving marauders are lurking everywhere... waiting to rob you of your hard gained treasures.

Facing tremendous odds, retreat can never be considered. Depending upon you are the innocent inhabitants held in bondage by the Witch King.

Fortress of the Witch King is ready to run on your Apple II, II+, IIe computer with 48K memory and one disk drive.

A true heart, brave spirit and goodness persevere... and no matter how many times you fail, you rise again to fulfill your mission.

Average game: 50-100 turns
1-Player time: 3 hours
4-Player time: 6 hours

152322.name: Mickey Mouse Flip Chip
152322.description: Mickey Mouse Flip Chip is an odd kind of connect 4 game, you use levers built into the base to launch chips up that randomly fall into the board. First player to 4 in a row wins.

152323.description:
Krampus is a Werewolf/Mafia re-theme for the holidays where some players are Krampusz, a race of Alpine Christmas demons who abduct naughty children and carry them off to their lair to eat. Most of the players, though, are children who are trying to tattle to the Parent (the moderator) about the right Krampusz. There are also a variety of other Christmas roles, including Frosty, Elf on the Shelf, Jesus, and the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present, and Future.

If the children correctly tattle on all of the Krampusz, they win. If the Krampusz outnumber the children, they win.
152323.name: Krampus

152324.description:
Collect a Corpse is a tile laying, build your own royal corpse, game for two players. There is also some dice rolling.

You start the game with either the torso of the king or the queen of Sweden. The goal is to finish your corpse as complete as possible with your own limbs at the right places.

On your turn you draw a card that either shows a bodypart of either the king or the queen, a black dice or a white dice.
If it's a bodypart (it doesn't have to be your own) place it on your torso. You can later exchange them for parts matching your torso if you have the maximum number of that part (usually 2).
If it's a card roll a die and see the charts: The white die is usually constructive for you and the black die destructive for your opponent.

When the last card is drawn you score points. Parts matching your torso score double points if they are in the right place otherwise the score the number printed on them (inner parts give 2 the outer 3 points). You get no points for the opponents parts on your body.
152324.name: Collect A Corpse

152325.name: Knightcap
152325.description:
Knightcap is played by two players (light and dark) on an 8x8 chess-like board with 63 horses of the same color. Both player can use every horse as long as that horse can jump to an empty field in a chess-like manner. The piece jumped over is captured.
The dark player only captures pieces on dark fields, the light player only those on light fields. Multiple captures in a single turn are possible.

A single point is scored for every horse captured over the amount of 30. First player to reach 10 points wins. Several rounds may be played to reach the goal.

152326.name: Democracy
152326.description:
Democracy was published in the year of the first democratic elections in South Africa - 1994.

In Democracy you are the leader of a political party. All players try to increase their influence with partymembers and their assets such as business, news papers, TV etc. (75 influence cards). Some of the character- and asset-cards show guaranteed votes. The assets must be assigned to a character.
Players can trade their influence cards (assets) freely.

There are 120 event cards with positive and negative effects - so there is a lot of luck. These generate income, which is needed to pay some bad events or the travel-costs from region to region by car or plane, or have direct effects to your political reputation.

The partymembers travel throughout the country canvassing in the regions. Each region has a base resistance of 7. The influence of the canvassing partymember(s) + their assets + D6 must be greater to win the region. Players mark their regions with vote counters - each region is worth 1 vote.

An election is called - 2 ways:
- Automatically after all 50 regions are won, or
- A player can call for an election if he has one of 3 election-card (and only after a minimum of rounds are over, depending on number of players).
Than the last 5 rounds are played. In this "window period" nearly everything is allowed. Players can play special influence cards such as muckrakers, callgirls, third forces or assassins to "destroy" the political reputation or even kill the party leader. Hopefully he has (and can pay) bodyguards ...
Only in this period a player can take a region from another party.

Winning of the game - 2 ways:
- When all other party leaders are killed you win
- After the election, the player with the most votes wins.

152327.name: Memoria

videogamehonor.35522: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

152327.description:
User Summary

Memoria is a point-and-click adventure, which continues the story from the game Chains of Satinav. It weaves the two stories of Princess Sadja (in the past) and Geron the bird catcher (in the present) into a tale of "ancient magic, enigmas and unexpected twists".

152328.name: Sons Of Liberty 1773
152328.description:
Boston, December 16, 1773. The Sons of Liberty boarded the tea ships and threw the chests of tea into Boston Harbor. This is the key event to the birth of American Revolutionary war which leads to the United States of America birth. In this game you will relive this historical adventure.

The deck is composed of 57 cards: 24 American cards, 24 Great Britain cards and 9 special cards

In each turn, you launch an attack to the next player. He/she can defend it or ally to it. To ally, he/she needs to play a card with the same numeric value, without taking into account the faction. The joint attack passes to the next player. This third player can ally or defend too. To defend, he/she needs to play cards from the opposite faction and with a higher number value than the attacking ones. After defending, each player can add more cards to the attack. If the attack is defended properly the attacking and defending cards are discarded. If it is not, the defending player puts in his hand all attacking and defending cards. When the deck runs out, the first player who runs out of cards is the winner. Also, there are special cards which modify a little bit the game rules.

152329.name: SpellForce: Platinum Edition
152329.description:
User Summary

Compilation of SpellForce: The Order of Dawn and its two expansions.

152331.name: MLB Front Office Manager
152331.description:
MLB® Front Office Manager gives baseball fans the chance to experience their dream job. Take the reins of your favorite Major League™ team and build a championship roster. Make trades, sign free agents, draft prospects and manage games all the way from Spring Training through the Playoffs.

Source: The Publisher Website.

152332.name: Cootie Catchers
152332.description:
From the introduction:

“You’ve got cooties!” is a familiar cry in many schoolyards in English-speaking countries. Most kids only have the vaguest idea what that means, but they know it’s nothing they want. They know they’re contagious and can make you a pariah, and that’s all they need to know.

“Cootie” is actually an old word for “head louse,” but when I was young we thought of them more as germs or even a contagious social-psychic condition. In this game, they can be something far worse than either lice or bacteria.

Cootie Catchers is set in a non-specific schoolyard in a non-specific time – the Game Master (GM) should choose one she knows or makes up. The players are elementary school children, perhaps 8-10 years old. The game begins with the taunting of a Non-Player Character (NPC) child that she has cooties. At that point, the players notices that the NPC really does have something strange going on. Very strange – it almost looks as if the NPC is not herself anymore. As if something else is controlling her. As if Cooties really do exist and are far more baleful than has been supposed…

152333.name: Fate of the Norns (Revised 1st Edition)
152333.description:
user summary

In 2012, for the first time, one of the products of the Fate of the Norns line was released in print form.

the original 80 page Fate of the Norns (1st Edition) PDF was released in 1993

The expanded product (320 pages) was the first edition of Fate of the Norns released in print

this Limited Printing hardcover was only available in 2012 ans 2013

152334.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 178 - Jun 1990)
152334.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #178
June 1990

Cover art by Matthew Porter.

152335.name: Master Break

videogameversion.228054: English/European BBC Micro and Master Series 5 1/4" Disk edition

152335.description:
From the inlay (Play It Again Sam 17 compilation re-release):

Snooker-style trivia quiz game for 1-4 players. Over 1500 questions on Science & Nature, Sport, Pop Music, Geography, etc. All the fun of a trivia quiz and snooker match rolled into one enthralling game.

Credits:

Game Author: Walter Mansell

152336.name: Video's Revenge
152336.description:
From the inlay (Superior Software "Play It Again Sam 17" compilation re-release):

You have to blast the invading aliens as they form in wave attacks and clear them in the allotted time before they turn into superbreeds and become faster and more dangerous. Successive waves attack faster in more ferocious and menacing formations.

There are some special features to help you. If you have enough energy units, Smart Bombs will blast all aliens from the screen. If you have enough energy units, Inviso-flight gives you temporary invisibility and makes you indestructable. If you blast the alien energy balloon 23 times and catch the alien energy pack, then your firepower multiplies threefold.

User Summary

Video's Revenge was originally released on Alligata's budget label, Budgie, and is highly reminiscent of the arcade classic 'Defender'. The main differences are that the game plays vertically rather than horizontally, and that there are no humans to 'defend'. Instead, a time limit is applied to each level. As when all humans are lost in 'Defender', when the time runs out, the enemies mutate into stronger and more powerful versions.

The concept of being able to fly backwards or forwards, seeing a small portion of a much larger wrap-around play area (with a radar showing the location of all enemies) is familiar to players of 'Defender'. Also familiar are the smart-bomb capability and several of the aliens, for example one which when hit splits into three small pyramid shaped ships.

152337.name: Play It Again Sam 17

videogameversion.228057: English/European BBC Micro (B, B+) and Master 128 Series 5 1/4" Disk edition

152337.description:
User Summary

This is the seventeenth release in Superior Software's popular series of Play It Again Sam compilations.

It includes four games:

Summer Olympiad - A 1-4 player game based around five Olympic sporting events.
Tactic - A BBC Micro conversion of the Archimedes original, only available on this compilation. A falling blocks game where the objective is to match particular patterns displayed at the bottom of the screen.
Video's Revenge - A shoot-em-up strongly reminiscent of the arcade classic 'Defender'.
Master Break - A trivia quiz game themed as a snooker match.

152338.name: Nouvelle Cuisine
152338.description:
from the forward

In this diceless mini RPG players pretend to be a restaurant’s staff: the Renowned Critic (played by the GM) has just walked in and is now is sitting at a table, waiting for new meat to feed his pen on. His review will weigh on the restaurant’s future.

152339.name: Mistborn: Birthright
152339.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN DEVELOPMENT




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




The game takes place hundreds of years before the events of the Mistborn trilogy, during the early years of the Final Empire. The player will play as the arrogant young nobleman Fendin "Fiddle" Fathvell, a Mistborn. He must quickly master his newfound Allomantic abilities before forces at work can destroy his entire family.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mistborn: Birthright," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

152340.name: Zomtrak
152340.description:
A diceless card driven Euro style board game about a Zombie Pandemic on the US Passenger Rail Network.

Description from the Kickstarter:

"In Zomtrack, the cards control the action.

You draw a hand of cards and use them to implement the strategy you have chosen. Back the survivors and spend your time destroying infestations and gaining victory points (VPs) and bonus cards. Did the horde you backed become dominant? Did the survivors’ strongholds hold out? End-of-game bonus cards score based on how well the strategy you backed ends up working."

152341.name: Monopoly: Seattle Mariners
152341.description: The classic Monopoly game with a Seattle Mariners theme. Beloved Mariners Players & Coaches replace the classic Monopoly properties. Ichiro and Safeco Field replace Park Place and Boardwalk. Home and Away Jersey cards replace classic Chance & Community Chest cards.

152342.name: Enslaved: Odyssey to the West – Pigsy's Perfect 10
152342.description:
Pigsy's Perfect 10 acts as a prequel to the main story where players take control of the character Pigsy. Since the player takes the role of Pigsy, the gameplay has also changed due to his difference in character and build compared to Monkey. While Pigsy can still climb over terrain, he cannot scale buildings as fast or athletically. Instead, Pigsy utilizes a mechanical grappling hand attached to his own to reach higher places and swing over obstacles and large gaps. When in combat, without the same fighting skills as Monkey, Pigsy instead wields a long-ranged rifle and grenades. Stealth is also a preferable approach to gameplay, requiring at times to avoid combat altogether.

Source: Wikipedia, "Enslaved:_Odyssey_to_the_West," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

152343.name: Mutterglück
152343.description:
User description

Mutterglück is a promotional adventure to accompany the release of the Demonicon video game release. It was available as a free give away at conventions and is also included in the Deluxe Collector's Edition of Demonicon.
The plot is losly tied to the video game.

152344.name: Kingdom Come: Deliverance

videogamehonor.42672: 2017 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

152344.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Kingdom Come: Deliverance draws its inspiration from historically authentic characters, themes, and warfare. It will be set in 15th Century medieval central Europe, specifically at the time of the Hussites and will feature no magic, high fantasy, or mythical overtones. The game will have period-accurate armor and clothing, actual combat and fencing techniques, and real-world castles recreated with the assistance of architects and historians. The game will also contain period music recorded by Czech masters that were taken note for note from ancient song books.

The game will feature horseback combat, open-field sieges, and large-scale battles, all while developing relationships and a reputation that will effect the story. Before going into battle weapons may need some resharpening, repairing, or you may craft news ones in a skill/stat-based mini game, not in a menu. Creating potions, ointments through alchemy, picking locks and pockets, fishing, mining, distilling alcohol, and preparing food will all be done with similar mini-games. Eating and sleeping will be required to keep your strength up and perishables held onto for too long may go bad.

152345.description:
La Patrie en Danger is another fine game from OSG's publisher Kevin Zucker's famous series "The Library of Napoleonic Battles". Based on the epic "Napoleon's Last Battles"-System, (further upgraded to the Library of Napoleonic Battles): it shows 480 meters per hex, 1 hour per turn, 400-800 men per strength point. Each Approach to Battle game lasts about 20 turns. The Full campaign links the individual battles.

This game contains five battles from the opening phase of the 1814 Campaign in France following the Battle of Nations, which was fought just half a year before at Leipzig.

Napoleon has just arrived at the front. At their first encounter the French surprised Blücher's Prussians and Russians during a snowstorm. The Battle of Brienne was a short-lived success, however, for just two days later the Prussians triumphed at La Rothière and wrote-off the enemy as a spent force, advancing hell-for-leather across the Marne and onto the highway to Paris. Ten days later Napoleon seized his opportunity when "Marschal Vorwärts" allowed his advancing columns to get dispersed and defeated in detail, in rapid succession in three short sharp combats.

BATTLES SIMULATED
Brienne Unskilled Fury, 29-30 January.
The raw conscripts under Napoleon and Ney chased the Russians and Prussians from the town. Bluucher himself was almost captured.

La Rothière A Defeat on French Soil, 1 February.
Reinforced with troops from the Army of Bohemia, Blücher was ready to fight again. Napoleon, not realizing the enemy's overwhelming superiority, advanced. At Noon Blücher attacked, taking 54 guns and inflicting 6,000 French casualties.

Champaubert, 10 February.
Marmont ran into an isolated corps of 4,500 Russians commanded by Olsufief. Marmont attacked and dispersed the Russian corps, capturing its commander.

Montmirail, 11 February.
Mortier pinned down Yorck and Kleist's Prussians to the front, while Napoleon separated Sacken's Russians from their allies, sending them streaming back towards Château Thierry.

Vauchamps, 14 February.
Marmont held Blücher's Prussians in check while Napoleon made a flank march through the mud, sending Grouchy's cavalry round to the rear to cut their retreat to Châlons.

COMPONENTS
Three 22" x 34" maps
560 counters
100 cards
2 rulebooks
15 player aids
Box

GAME SYSTEM:
The Library of Napoleonic Battles - formerly known as the "Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB-)Series"
- scale = 480m/hex,
- time = 1hour/GT,
- strength = 500-800 men/SP.
152345.name: La Patrie en Danger 1814

152346.name: Time Surfer
152346.description:
From the Publisher / Developer Website:

Surf for your life across the galaxy!

An inevitable destructive force is after you... The end of the universe! Your only hope? You can cheat death by rewinding time!

152347.name: Occult Mysteries
152347.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Terrible Truth!

Every civilization has its big questions, those mysteries that have plagued generations of scholars. How did humanity rise from barbarism? Why did the gnomes leave the First World? Who are the string-pulling veiled masters? What is the Aucturn Enigma, and what strange powers did it grant the rulers of Osirion? What secret could be so great that it led to the suppression of volume five of the Pathfinder Chronicles? Within these covers, all these questions—and far more dangerous secrets—are explored at last.

Occult Mysteries shines a light on the darkest mysteries of the Pathfinder campaign setting. Within this book, you’ll find:


In-depth explorations of five of the most debated questions of the Pathfinder campaign setting, including the origins of life, the exodus of the gnomes, and the designs of the veiled masters.



Insights into the workings and agendas of eight secret societies like the Anaphexia, the Esoteric Order of the Palatine Eye, and the Knights of the Ioun Star, as well as rules for joining their hidden ranks.



Revelations on esoteric traditions such as astrology, numerology, spiritualism, and more, along with a host of new rules and character options to help integrate them into your game.



Entirely new ways to divine and influence characters’ futures with Golarion’s zodiac, the Cosmic Caravan, as well as a system for using the harrow deck to inspire game-changing plot twists.



Details on six of the most infamous texts in Golarion, along with the hidden powers that make them so dangerous.



Numerous options for players, including new feats and spells, ritual magic items, the pain taster prestige class, the occult oracle mystery, and more.

152348.name: Wrath of the Righteous Poster Map Folio

rpghonor.26119: 2014 ENnie for Best Cartography - Silver Winner

152348.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the corrupt terrain of the Worldwound, one of the most terrifying lands in the Pathfinder campaign setting, with the Wrath of the Righteous Poster Map Folio. Study the alien home of the demons, make a stand inside a doomed city, or plot your crusade on three massive poster maps designed for use with the Wrath of the Righteous Adventure Path.

Huge, lavishly illustrated poster maps depict the crusader city of Kenabres (the setting for the first Wrath of the Righteous adventure) and the Abyss-touched territory of the Worldwound. The third map is a giant player-oriented illustration of the Abyss itself, presented as an ink-and-parchment drawing of this otherworldly realm of ultimate evil and its hideous denizens! Whether you’re looking for an embattled but defiant city or a mysterious extraplanar realm, these beautiful maps are the perfect resource for the Wrath of the Righteous Adventure Path or any fantasy campaign.

152349.name: The Harrow Handbook
152349.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s in the Cards!

Pierce the veil of mystery surrounding the occult symbolism of the harrow! Steeped in ancient tradition, harrow decks have been used for centuries to foretell the future, perform magical feats, send coded messages and warnings, and manipulate fate. Divine your fortune, learn games of skill and chance, summon allies, curse enemies, or even build a character based on harrow archetypes as you delve into the lore and secrets of the cards.

Pathfinder Player Companion: Harrow Handbook presents a player-focused overview of the history, fortune-telling practices, and non-divinatory uses of the harrow deck, including ways to incorporate harrowing into your character’s background and skills. Every Pathfinder Player Companion includes new options and tools for every Pathfinder RPG player. These are just a few of the features you’ll find inside this book:


New archetypes, building types, equipment, feats, spells, and traits to help you incorporate the mystic secrets of the harrow into your characters and campaigns.



A guide to the lost harrow cards that sometimes appear unexpectedly in harrow decks, or are discovered in ancient tombs and lost hoards.



A new system for generating character backgrounds and motivations using the harrow deck, with associated traits.



Instructions for performing a harrow reading, and information on alternate harrow spreads used in telling fortunes.



Rules for games that use the harrow cards and are played everywhere from upper-class card parlors in Cheliax to underground gambling dens in Absalom.

152350.name: Deluxe Harrow Deck
152350.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The future is yours to reveal with the Pathfinder Cards: Deluxe Harrow Deck! The symbols and legends of the Pathfinder Campaign Setting fill this 55-card, full-color set of oversized fortunetelling cards, making it an invaluable tool for including divination and mysticism in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventures. Learn how to read the Harrow and include its powers in any Pathfinder RPG game with rule cards detailing spells, fortunetelling methods, and other insights into its use. With portentous art, patterned backing, and a larger size common to many real-world tarot decks, the Deluxe Harrow Deck straddles the lines between game supplement, storytelling set piece, and costume prop. Know what’s in store for your Pathfinder character with the Pathfinder Cards: Deluxe Harrow Deck!

152351.name: Tides of Battle
152351.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Master the battlefield with Pathfinder Cards: Tides of Battle! This exciting new combat expansion to the Pathfinder RPG turns your hero’s diverse strengths and talents into dramatic combat maneuvers, lethal opportunities, and surges of power when you need them most—all while provoking thrilling turns of fate. Add new excitement and danger to your Pathfinder RPG encounters by unleashing the Tides of Battle!

user comment
this deck contains 54 cards

152352.name: Social Combat
152352.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Where swords and spells may fail, a sharp mind and a quick tongue can triumph! This 52-card deck introduces an exciting new method to infuse social intrigue in any Pathfinder campaign. Social Combat uses a system similar to Chase Cards, but instead of catching or escaping foes, heroes use guile, charm, and even treachery to win friends and manipulate foes. Every card presents a social challenge to face, and a number of ways to win the day with words and charm instead of brute force and spell power. This is a perfect supplement for campaigns where intrigue, skullduggery, and rhetorical flourish play center stage!

152353.name: Tears at Bitter Manor
152353.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Unlock the past! Get the most out of Pathfinder Module: Tears at Bitter Manor with this custom-made assortment of characters, treasures, and more! Item Cards help you track all the best items and equipment, Face Cards depict the most important NPCs, and new Quest Cards summarize key adventure goals to keep players on track. Designed specifically for use with Pathfinder Module: Tears at Bitter Manor, this beautifully illustrated 54-card deck is easily this deadly dungeon’s greatest treasure!

152354.description:
"Save the Christmas" in English.
Roll and move on the board and who finishes first is the winner.
152354.name: Päästa Jõulud

152355.name: Deep, Dark, Random Forest
152355.description: DDR Forest is a two-player constructible board game that combines strategy and luck. Collect three Relic Cards and land on your opponent’s Starting Square. Die rolls determine your movement. Cards are played to hinder your opponent’s progress. The board unfolds at random each turn allowing for a different map every game.

152356.name: Bestsellers - Operation Flashpoint
152356.description:
User Summary

This compilation includes all three campaigns for the original Operation Flashpoint (with the latest patch, the game is renamed to "ArmA Cold War Assault").

Along with the original 'Cold War Crisis' campaign, it also includes the Red Hammer and Resistance add-ons.

152357.name: Vicious Villains IV: Psychotic Psychics
152357.description:
Vicious Villains IV: Psychotic Psychics is a collection of pre-generated characters that can be added to any M&M 3rd Edition game. This book contains ten pre-generated supervillains who possess psychic powers!
