Perfect antagonists for your M&M 3rd edition game, or for the brave troupe that wants to run an all villains game, these characters cover a range of power level from 6-15! All point totals are noted on the character sheet for easy customization by players or GMs!

Vicious Villains IV: Psychotic Psychics includes:
Bedekte Sy Het-Duiwel: A veiled devil with a hypnotizing dance.
Cassandra: A former hero turned supervillain after she failed to predict the murder of her family.
Fortea: An NSA agent with an unreasoning hatred of psychics and an immunity to their powers.
Citizen Freedom: A revered superhero who hides a terrible secret under a poerful illusion.
Frost Queen: A deranged cryokinetic who thinks she is the Queen of Winter.
Luna: A mass-murdering sociopath who reads minds and kills for fun.
Masochista: A biokinetic empath who gains strength by inflicting pain on others.
Mindscream: An alien criminal exiled to Earth and obsessed with getting home.
Ronin: Once a protector of the innocent, Ronin is dishonored and has vowed revenge...on superheroes!.
Thought Hounds: A race of telepathic invaders who spy on humanity from their subterranean enclaves.

152358.name: Airport Football
152358.description:
Tired of "Tic-Tac-Toe" and "Hangman"? Try Pencil Football (a.k.a. Airport Football)! It's a paper and pencil game for 1 or 2 players simulating a game of American Football. All you need to play is something to write on and something to write with. That means it's free!

The game is played in 4 quarters. Each quarter consists of a player taking a turn on offense and on defense. Offense always starts at their opponent's 35 yard line.

Offense: You have 4 downs to score. Write the appropriate letters in a 6-digit code to represent your play:
Run = three 'R's
Pass = two 'P's
Hail-Mary = three 'P's
Field Goal = one, two, or three 'F's (depending on field position: >30, 10 - 30, <10 yard line)

Defense: Without seeing your opponent's play, choose 3 distinct numbers between 1 and 6. These are the left-to-right digits in the offense's play that you block this down.

A run is successful and moves the offense 10 yards if at least two 'R's are unblocked.
A pass is successful and moves the offense 20 yards if both 'P's are unblocked.
A hail-mary is successful and results in an instant touchdown if all 3 'P's are unblocked.
A field goal is successful if at least 1 'F' is unblocked.

If you score a touchdown you can attempt a field goal from the 5 yard line or attempt a 2-point conversion from the 5 yard line.

152359.name: Machiavelli
152359.description:
There are three main actions that the player can decide to play:
Play a valid combination of cards on the table.
Add one or more cards to an existing combination of cards.
Draw a card from the deck if you don't play any cards.

The defining feature of Machiavelli is being able to make changes to the combinations of cards already on the table. The current player, if desired, may reorganize the cards in order to make new combos that make it easier to play one or more cards in his hand. All new combinations must be valid, and players can not remove any cards already on the table.

The player who manages to play all the cards in his hand wins the game.

There is a fundamental difference from Rummy/Manipulation: there is no discarding, which makes it far more difficult to get rid of all cards.

152360.description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Designer Edition Kickstarter project, where Roy (Thirdpower) Kubicek pledged $4,500 for the creation and distribution of this set of Nihon units.

Here are the unit descriptions:

Looking at the front, left to right, top to bottom:

A Mark III-B and two Mark 1, 5 GEVs, 4 Infantry, 3 Heavy Tanks, 4 Marines, 2 Missile Tanks, 4 Light GEVs, 3 Light Tanks, 1 HW Team, 1 Missile Crawler, 1 Crawler, 5 GEV-PC, 2 SuperHeavy, 1 Mobile HWZ.

There are other assorted counters as well.
152360.name: Ogre: Nihon Empire – North American Divisions Sponsored Counter Sheet

152362.description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project. These set was one of several given as a Backer Exclusive Promo.

The first of three exclusive Kickstarter counter sheets has green Mark III, IV and V Ogres and a lot of things for them to blow up. 3-D counters include Combine and Paneuro Reactors, a destroyed Ogre, a burnt-out tower, and more!

This double sheet set includes Sheets K1 and L1.

Available for Kickstarter backers (only) to order.
152362.name: Ogre: "Targets Go Boom" Counter Sheets

152363.description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project. These set was one of several given as a Backer Exclusive Promo.

The second of three exclusive Kickstarter counter sheets has a variety of map overlays not found in the standard set of Ogre Designer's Edition. Large cities, rivers and lakes, a marshy delta, and more, providing additional map customization and scenario building options!

This double sheet set includes Sheets M1 and M2.
152363.name: Ogre: Kickstarter Exclusive Overlays Counter Sheets

152364.name: Star Wars Millennium Falcon CD-ROM Playset
152364.description:
User Summary

Explore 7 of the planets in the Star Wars Galaxy! In this game you will get to pilot some of the more iconic starships around the following locations:
Dagobah, Tantooine, Hoth, Bespin, Endor, Yavin IV, Death Star.

It came packaged with a plastic toy that would strap to your keyboard. Moving either figure kit the keys.

152365.description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project. These set was one of several given as a Backer Exclusive Promo.

The last of three exclusive Kickstarter counter sheets has a pair of Vulcans, Nihon and Vatican command posts, Combine and Paneuro Engineers and Heavy Weapons Teams, a Mark VI, a Doppelsoldner, and more!

This double sheet set includes Sheets P1 and Q1.

Available for Kickstarter backers (only) to order.
152365.name: Ogre: Vulcans & Friends Counter Sheets

152366.description: Cards Against Humanity sent out a request in November 2013: 100,000 people sent them $12 to receive something in return over a 12-day period. Each treat is also part of a larger puzzle. The packs listed in the versions here are expansion cards which were sent as a result.
152366.name: Cards Against Humanity: 12 Days of Holiday Bullshit

152367.name: Der bunte Pipifax
152367.description: Players roll a colored die and are allowed to place a piece of the color they rolled on a space of the same color on their "Pipifax", a jester whose clothing they need to fill with pieces.

152368.description: Players place triangular tiles with colored edges, trying to form squares. However, tiles can only be placed in a way so that adjacent edges have the same color. Some triangles contain apples or pears. Forming squares where all tiles contain the same fruit yields double points.
152368.name: Triangel Domino

152369.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 180 - Aug 1990)
152369.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #180
August 1990

Cover art by SG & GDS.

152370.name: Allegiance
152370.description:
The Theme

You are a priest of a troubled Temple. A Thieves’ Guild has emerged and is challenging your Temple for influence over the land. You must decide whether to work along with your brethren in the fight against the Thieves Guild or betray your brothers and guide the Thieves’ Guild to prominence.


Gameplay

In Allegiance, players use cards to adjust the influence of the Thieves’ Guild and Temple. At the end of the game, the organization with the most influence emerges to prominence. Players’ allegiance can shift during the game as they accrue cards that align them with either the Temple or the Thieves’ Guild. All players with allegiance to the Temple win if the Temple has the most influence. One player with allegiance to the Thieves’ Guild wins if the Thieves’ Guild has the most influence.

Will the players maintain allegiance to the Temple and work cooperatively to try to achieve victory? Or will one or more of them turn rogue and align with the Thieves’ Guild in a high-risk, high-reward attempt to win it all?

152372.name: Amoebas in Space! Episode 23: My Spaceship for a Sandwich
152372.description:
Designer description:

A taste of things to come...

After defeating the Warbling Zizifrex of An-Emhavla III, the crew of the Starship Lobosa feel they have earned some down time. After contacting their superiors at the Galactic Amorphous Space Patrol, they have been granted shore leave at the closest planet in the system, Mabrox V.

Mabrox V is know for its delightful spas, spacious hotels, and gourmet sandwiches. Travel time from the crew's present location is two days.

Two uneventful days pass. The crew can almost taste the sandwiches. And then the ship lands in the stellar parking lot. As the team leaves the ship and locks it, they notice a few issues. The parking lot is strewn with red tape. There is a crowd of irate patrons milling around. And several overworked security guards are hurrying in their direction.

“I'm sorry, but we'll have to ask you to leave, the Gastronomic Glitterati is closed.”

Unwilling to leave before knowing what has happened, the crew shows their credentials. The change in the guards is immediate.

“GASP is here! We're saved!”

Somehow the crew no longer thinks this vacation will be as easy as pie...

Welcome to Amoebas in Space! Episode 23: My Spaceship for a Sandwich.
A Build Your Own (Sandwich) Adventure!
For 2 to 6 players.

The goal of the party is to get a sandwich. However, this is not as easy as it appears.

The hotel, cabins, spa, and restaurants are shut down.
They are overrun with all manner of creatures run amok.
There are no completed sandwiches.

This means the party will have to collect the items necessary to make up a sandwich. After they have collected the items, they can make a sandwich. Good luck! And good eating!

152373.name: Foes of Ali
152373.description:
From the back of the North America 3DO box:

The Greatest of ALL-Time.

EA SPORTS presents the most stunning, action-packed boxing simulation ever created. FOES OF ALI delivers a dynamic historical perspective of Muhammad Ali, as well as cutting edge graphics and awesome gameplay.

Foes of Ali:
George Chuvalo, Henry Cooper, Jimmy Ellis, Bob Foster, Joe Frazier, Sonny Liston, Ken Norton, Leon Spinks, and Chuck Wepner.

Key features:
Read boxers, feall skills.
-Muhammad Ali & 9 featured foes.
-Boxers' skills accurately represented.
-Advanced artificial intelligence, motion captured video, and bitmapped polygon technology.
-Realistic fight damage includes double, blurred, and partial vision, as well as seeing "red."

Fight features:
-Go head-to-head with another player or against the computer.
-3 fight modes; Career, Exhibition, and Tournament.
-15 different fight features allow you to customize each championship bout.

TV-style Presentation:
-21 different camera angles- changed views on-the-fly.
-Championship photos.

152375.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 187 - Mar 1991)
152375.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 187
March 1991

Cover art by Spike Jones.

152376.description:
From the product:

Arrrrgh! The shores and seas of Crystalia are ripe for plunder and where the loot is Captain R is sure to be found. Such is this legendary pirate's greed that not even death could keep him from his beloved treasure. Now the Consul can enlist the services of this cutthroat Mini-Boss of the seas and use some of that precious Treasure and Loot that those thieving Heroes so desire.

Contains:
1 Fully Assembled Captain R Miniature
Captain R Mini-Boss Game Card
Unique "Black Spot" Treasure Card
152376.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Captain R

152377.name: Dead Light
152377.description:
Publisher blurb:

Surviving One Night Outside of Arkham

The storm had been brewing for days and now it hits! Combined with restless, idle youth and the desire for easy money, something has been released out there amid the darkness, the howling wind, and lashing rain.

Dead Light is an adventure scenario for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying system designed to be played in one or more gaming sessions. An exercise in Lovecraftian-flavored survival horror, the unwitting investigators are caught up in a spiral of terror where only their quick thinking, and courage, will see them through till the clouds clear and a new dawn beckons.

Suitable as a stand alone adventure or as a sidetrack within a larger campaign, Dead Light is set in Lovecraft Country, north of Arkham, during the early 1920s and is ideal for groups of between three to six players.

This is one journey your players will not soon forget.

152378.name: Endgame
152378.description:
From the back of North American PS2 box:

Immersive Light-Gun Action

Loaded with awesome special effects such as anti-aliasing, motion blur, soft shadows, particle systems, and positional sound.

Over 20 locations based on painstakingly detailed settings spanning the globe.

Fully interactive and destructible environments with dynamic explosion effects.

Over 6 different modes of play- including training mode and a double-gun mode.

Unsurpassed enemy AI- enemies react to how you are playing with exclusive Hypermode technology.

152379.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Molot
152379.description:
Among the Red Block striders, the Molot is undoubtedly the most threatening. With two light flamers it can destroy almost any infantry unit with one volley. As part of division they make a real firestorm, which can turn any opponent into smoldering debris.

The downside of the Molot is the limited range of his weapons.

Equipped with two speakers, it doesn't only strike fear into the hearts of his enemies but it can also broadcast messages to the officers, hereby eliminating any risk of misunderstood or manipulated orders.

Contains:
1 Molot with 2 light flamers
1 supply container
2 cards

152380.name: Sherlock Holmes: Crimes & Punishments

videogamehonor.35068: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

152380.description:
The game is split into seven cases such as murders, disappearances, thefts, etc. written in the tradition of Arthur Conan Doyle’s novels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sherlock Holmes: Crimes & Punishments," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

152381.name: You Don't Know Jack HeadRush

videogamecompilation.167546: You Don't Know Jack: Classic Pack

152381.description:
User Summary

This is the teen version of the pop culture trivia game series formatted like a television game show. Up to 3 players can play using the same keyboard.

152382.description:
Merville Gun Battery expands SMG play with three structures from the battlefield including a Casemate, an MG Bunker and a set of Minefields.

6 new scenarios recreate the assault on a key objective during the opening hours of Operation Overlord as the lightly armed, scattered remnants of a British paratrooper battalion attack the hardened Merville bunker complex.

Contents:
X4A Casemate #1 - a 3-D concrete bunker
X4G MG Bunker - a 3-D concrete MG gunning position
3 pieces of minefield terrain
4 Terrains cards
6 Landmark cards
6 Order cards
152382.name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Merville Gun Battery Normandy Expansion

152384.name: Artifacts & Oddities Collection 1
152384.description:
Publisher Blurb

"The Artifacts and Oddities Collection I is a companion to the The Cypher Collection I, another compilation of new devices to use in your Numenera games. In this collection, you’ll find more than thirty brand new artifacts that can be added into any campaign. Additionally, you’ll find nearly one hundred new oddities to delight and confound your players."

152385.name: Pochecko
152385.description:
Pochecko is a strategy board game that combines aspects of Poker and Chess. It is a 2-4 player game for ages 12+.

In Pochecko, the players move markers around a board in order to claim poker cards and build a poker hand off of 1 of 2 community cards. As a counter maneuver, players may instead move one of the community blockers in order to block opponents from claiming the hand they are going for. The player with the best 5 card poker hand at the end of the game wins.

152386.name: Inflation
152386.description:
From the rules: "The object of the game is not only to afford amusement to the players but also to illustrate to them how proposed Share-the-Wealth Plans, Excessive Old Age Pension Plans, etc., will increase taxes and place a heavy burden on all citizens and, at the same time, make it possible for the shrewd manipulators to gain a dominating position in economical affairs of the country.

At the outset, let it be understood that before the Government can bring about a share-the-wealth program it must own all properties and all monies. Under a share-the-wealth scheme it is proposed that the Government shall make every man a king and give each person an equal share of the money, after which time each must take care of himself. If a man has good luck and is a shrewd manager, he may beat the game of "inflation." If he isn't, he will be no better off than theretofore and distribution of the wealth of the country will not have availed him anything".


This game is played like modern Monopoly. From Wikipedia: "Inflation board game came to the attention of Parker Brothers management in the 1930s, after they began sales of Monopoly. Copeland continued sales of the latter game after Parker Brothers attempted a patent lawsuit against him. Parker Brothers held the Magie and Darrow patents, but settled with Copeland rather than going to trial, since Copeland was prepared to have witnesses testify that they had played Monopoly before Darrow's "invention" of the game. The court settlement allowed Copeland to license Parker Brothers' patents".

152387.name: Black As Pitch
152387.description:
From the publisher's product description.

Black as Pitch is the third adventure in the Grendelssaga (after Rescue Run and Salvage Rights), a series of three adventures set on the rogue world of Grendel, in the Queen Alice’s Star system. Grendel is largely unexplored, an uninhabitable world in the next orbit out from the human colony world of Beowulf.

The British colonial government of Alicia is eager to engage with the Pentapods, having seen the benefits accrued to the French colony on Beta Canum. They are acting as quickly as possible, to forestall a French intervention, and present to the Home Office a fait accompli by having a treaty in place by the time the courier ship returns with instructions.

The Alician Colonial Government, in conjunction with the University of Alicia, has put together a project to rapidly expand the base on Grendel, increasing its scientific capabilities, as well as outfitting it as a human embassy to the Pentapods.

This final episode, set on the hostile world of Grendel, sees the characters forced into further co-operation with the alien Pentapods, as they delve into the secret kept by this planet for the past 100,000 years. Meanwhile, another threat awaits them on the surface, biding its time...

This final episode set on the hostile world of Grendel sees the characters forced into further cooperation with the alien Pentapods, as they delve into the secret kept by this planet for the past 100,000 years. Meanwhile, another threat awaits them on the surface, biding its time...

152388.description:
Mini-Expansion for Madeira.

Included in the Spielbox Magazine 7/2013

1 Character Card (Erntehelfer - The Harvester)

After the distribution of the four regular characters in phase A, the Erntehelfer comes into the remaining empty building.
In phase B, a player can alternatively place a guild or pirate dice on the Erntehelfer to perform a particular crop in the region of the Erntehelfer.
152388.name: Madeira: The Harvester

152389.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A two-pack of miniatures ready to play with your Please Stand By miniatures rules...or use them for any zombie miniatures game!
152389.name: Please Stand By: Zombie Miniatures

152390.name: Rhetorisches Quartett
152390.description:
Das Rethorische Quartett is a trick taking and communication game.

First, player agree on a topic and on opineons every player represents.
Each player has cards in his hand showing a kind of argumentations (not an argument, but something lika "non-representative statistic" or "personal attack" or "interpretational sovereignty". By turns players play cards and word an argument according to the card and the actual topic.

The cards have a letter and number and you can only play cards higher then the card played before.

As soon as no one can play an additional card, the one how played the last card gets the stack and the game continues with a new topic.

The player who scores the most cards is the winner.

152391.name: Day of the Worm
152391.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"Pulp: Hard-boiled detectives, fedora-wearing action heroes, and Steampunk gadgeteers rocketing to battle with their jet packs against bloodthirsty Thule cultists of the Third Reich." The Thule Society, a dark Nazi cult dedicated to furthering the esoteric knowledge that fuels the ever growing Third Reich, may have acquired the ancient Heart of Yhtill and all the power it promises. Worse still, they appear to have partnered with malevolent aliens known as the People of the Worm, who seek to ensure that World War II devastates the entire planet, leaving humankind ripe for conquest and consumption have come seeking the Heart as well. The PCs, working with the Allied forces, and alongside fanatical Ormazd Society allies, find themselves in a race against time to stop the People of the Worm from unleashing a doomsday device from within a hidden tomb in Egypt's Valley of the Kings. If only the Nazis and the People of the Worm were their only worries: there is another, equally mysterious force who want the Heart of Yhtill for their own alien agenda...

152394.name: The Krampus
152394.description:
From publisher blurb:

KRAMPUS!!

Locked away in another dimension until the last month of every year, The Krampus has been set loose on the world yet again! Lock your doors and bar your windows, for he's on the hunt for naughty boys and girls all around the world and has picked the heroes city for this year's pickings!

152395.name: Bards
152395.description:
From publisher blurb:

Characters in rpgs often have abilities are not tied to their class, race or skill, although they may be related/useful to it. These are called Feats.

They may be combat related, a way to tweak spells or even to do with the crafting of an item. Some will be useful to almost everyone, others only in very certain circumstances.

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about feats for Bards, those who confuse and confound their foes while inspiring their allies

The feats you'll find inside:

Anything for a fan
Improved Countersong
Improved Distraction
Improved Fascination
Improved Inspire Courage
Performance Enhancer
Power Slide
Shatter Wine Glass

152396.name: The Gadgeteer: Mother of Invention
152396.description:
From publisher blurb:

Invention is its own reward.

In a world brimming with wizards who learn the secrets of magic, sorcerers born with magic in their blood, and ethermancers who communicate with a cosmic blob of energy and subsequently throw bits of that blob around, it seems strange that there would be intelligent individuals who decide to work with the laws of physics rather than tell the laws of physics to sit down and shut up. Still, they exist.

These individuals are known as gadgeteers, imaginative engineers who prefer the hands-on nature of physical experimentation over the constantly staring at books that is arcane experimentation. Wielding custom-built weapons and a myriad of strange and amusing accessories, the primary advantage of the gadgeteer over the wizard is flexibility in creation. Though a wizard may know hundreds of spells, it takes weeks of work to make a fireball behave even slightly differently. A gadgeteer, on the other hand, can simply rewire her gadget tomorrow morning and have something new ready to go!

The end result of over two months of development, The Gadgeteer: Mother of Invention is Interjection Games' largest product by word count to date. Skirting the line between offensive spellcaster and support character, the gadgeteer's primary innovation is the advent of a Structure Point, or SP pool. These SP are used to create custom weapons from whatever stock weapons are lying around, as well as strange and ridiculous accessories that range from duct tape to a spy cigar stocked with everything from a one-exposure camera to a parachute. In short, a character who wants better accessories must make do with inferior weapons, and vice versa. Custom weapons and accessories can be changed daily, making the feel of the class somewhat like the Incarnum of the old Dungeons and Dragons 3.5 days.

Gadgeteers who invest in the Juryrigging feat become capable of creating accessories on the fly, much like a certain secret agent whose name prompts a roll on the Lawyer Random Encounter table.
Roleplayers are not left out in the cold with the gadgeteer! The Professional Angle class feature helps to define the gadgeteer's backstory and grants a number of bonus class skills that help the class behave the way the player wants it to be played. For the mechanically-inclined, this same class feature actually defines which of the three saving throws will have good progression, giving the optimizer that much more freedom.

Product Features

The Gadgeteer base class
Favored Class Bonuses for all common races and many featured races
A smattering of feats
58 custom weapon gadgets
13 accessories with a total of 97 addons, making each accessory comparable to a sorcerer bloodline or an oracle mystery

152397.name: Martian Hide: Classic Monsters Reskinned
152397.description:
From publisher blurb:

I am an unrepentant fan of the 1964 film Santa Claus Conquers the Martians. It know that it’s goofy, made on a ridiculously low budget, and has plot holes you could fly a team of reindeer through. I don’t care. It’s just fun. The idea that Martians would kidnap Santa Claus to help their children, because their own technological advancements have made them distant and cold, is sweet and touching. With a few notable exceptions, they’ve used their technological progress to move away from being a mighty warrior race toward being a kinder, more compassionate people.

The movie was meant to be a Cold War allegory, with the Martians standing in for the Soviets but it never quite works on that level. Certain Martians admired Earth culture and saw adapting to it as a way to resolve their own internal problems, sure, and the superiority of good old American whatever (because Santa is clearly American here, in spite of residing at the North Pole) proves true. I find more in common with modern society; the Martian children are glued to Earth television and have no concept of play, and modern kids are firmly planted in from of screen of various sizes and suffer from obesity because they have no concept of “outside”.

The film offers up an intersection of fantasy and science fiction that in and of itself makes it transportable to a fantasy roleplaying game. Martians can come from another planet or another plane. Their technology is reminiscent of the classic 1st edition adventure module where adventures explore peaked barriers and find robots and ray guns. There is precedent for this sort of silliness. If your campaign world lacks a Santa Claus analog, there are plenty of deities, demigods, and heroes that the Martians might want to kidnap back to their own world to help resolve their problems, whatever that may be.

For more on using Santa Claus Conquers the Martians as roleplaying game fodder, check out the systemless setting from Asparagus Jumpsuit, available where you acquired this holiday freebie. You should also check out other entries in the Monster Hide line, for variants of more traditional fantasy roleplaying game monsters.

152398.name: Goblin Hide: Classic Monsters Reskinned
152398.description:
From publisher blurb:

Growing up on Tolkien, I always thought of goblins as lesser orcs. More recent interpretations have cast them as comic relief, the villains that act goofy and do stupid things while you merrily slay them by the dozen. To find a proper place for them in my own Desteon campaign world, I’ve had to turn to folklore. Where orcs are raiders, sending an army to burn and pillage your town, the goblins pick around the edges. They sneak around, and steal food, and finished goods, and babies. They rely on tricks and annoyances to count coup against larger foes. They’re scary because they won’t ever come straight at you unless cornered, but they will find sneaky, underhanded ways to hurt you even if they’re too weak to kill you. Goblins will screw with your head.

My goblins are scavengers. They’re not mighty hunters. They aren’t particularly brave. They’re craven cowards, actually. They live on the fringes of the civilized world, in tapped-out mine tunnels abandoned by dwarves, in the swamps and caverns near villages and settlements, in the sewers underneath large cities. They don’t show themselves willingly, they don’t interact with other races unless the situation forces them to, and they generally hide from the light of day so they aren’t exterminated for acting like the vermin they are.

Goblin Hide is a bit different from other Monster Hide supplements, then, in that I make no attempt to instill this race with any noble qualities, or make them in any way sympathetic, or try to redeem them. Goblins are creepy, and disgusting, and a blight. They are the cockroaches of humanoids.

152399.name: Hobgoblin Hide: Classic Monsters Reskinned
152399.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hobgoblins are another of those races that I struggled to find a role for in my own campaign world of Desteon. Aren’t larger goblins just… orcs? But orcs in the current Pathfinder taxonomy aren’t goblins, they don’t have the goblin subtype, they’re a separate and distinct race. So hobgoblins are more akin to Tolkien orcs, but Pathfinder orcs are more like the post-Tolkien orcs used by everyone else in need of a savage beastman race. Which still leaves me with the question: Why are there two humanoid races that fill the same niche?

My answer is that hobgoblins are not native to my world. They are from another plane, where orcs are a goblinoid subtype. They invaded Desteon via the fey realms. That’s why there are so few of them, comparative to the number of “orc” orcs. My hobgoblins call themselves orcs, they hate being called hobgoblins, and they truly, deeply, passionately hate the creatures that have claimed their race-name. In my world, they may hate those they call “false orcs” more than they hate their hereditary enemies, the elves.

They difference in alignment works to support this alternate-reality difference as well. Orcs are chaotic evil, and just raid and pillage and wreak havoc at random. Hobgoblins are lawful evil, far more organized, prone to using siege engines and feats of engineering to carry out their detailed and plans and schemes. Their relatively small numbers also support these tactics. They can’t throw wave after wave of bodies at a fight like the orcs. They can’t afford those types of losses, or they’ll be wiped out as a race. They need to rely on secure strongholds, surgical strikes, and alliances with other races including their smaller cousins, the goblins.

Hobgoblin Hide, then, sets out to give this race a reason to exist, and to make them distinct from other races that seem to fill the same niche in a campaign world.

152400.name: Assault from the Sky
152400.description:
From publisher blurb:


SHARPNESS FROM THE SKY!

When the dread sky-ship Caligari drops its shadow on a town, death is certain to follow. Can anyone stop its crew, the lethal Skyblade Golems, or their Captain, Ludo the Ruthless? Someone had better try. Victorious adventurers may just get themselves a fancy sky-ship; defeated adventurers may learn that Ludo the Ruthless worked hard to earn his name!

This adventure uses the FREE Party Pack Fantasy Era Starter Kit; grab some rules, some characters, pick up a d20 and GO! Also usable with the complete Victory System Core Rulebook. Want to modify the Caligari or make vehicles of your own in the Victory System? Check out the Victory System Equipment Manual!

152401.name: Party Pack: Fantasy Era Starter Kit
152401.description:
From publisher blurb:


JUST ADD DICE!

Want to get a quick Fantasy game in? Here's everything you need to do it in one convenient package! Rules, Characters, even an introductory adventure... for FREE!

The Party Pack Fantasy Starter Kit Includes:

A streamlined set of basic rules adapted from The Victory System Core Rulebook!
Twelve (12) Full Characters... or rather, six (6) Characters presented as both male and female to suit individual players tastes
An introductory adventure
A fully-realized Villain and his minions!




Drive it around, kick the tires! This is a starter kit; be on the lookout for more Party Pack adventures using these basic characters; or pick up the Victory System Core Rulebook and make some characters of your own!

Fully compatible with The Victory System; you may want to pick up the Victory System Core Rulebook for more gear, abilities, and character advancement! You may also want a copy of the Victory System Equipment Manual to modify equipment, or to create your very own!

152402.name: Party Pack: Near-Modern Era Starter Kit
152402.description:
From publisher blurb:


JUST ADD DICE!

Want to get a quick Urban Fantasy or Near-Modern game in? Here's everything you need to do it in one convenient package! Rules, Characters, even an introductory adventure... for FREE!

The Party Pack Near-Modern Starter Kit Includes:

A streamlined set of basic rules adapted from The Victory System Core Rulebook!
Twelve (12) Full Characters... or rather, six (6) Characters presented as both male and female to suit individual players tastes
An introductory adventure
A fully-realized Villain and his minions!




Drive it around, kick the tires! This is a starter kit; be on the lookout for more Party Pack adventures using these basic characters; or pick up the Victory System Core Rulebook and make some characters of your own!

Fully compatible with The Victory System; you may want to pick up the Victory System Core Rulebook for more gear, abilities, and character advancement! You may also want a copy of the Victory System Equipment Manual to modify equipment, or to create your very own!

152403.name: Party Pack: Space Era Starter Kit
152403.description:
From publisher blurb:


JUST ADD DICE!

Want to get a quick Science-Fiction game in? Here's everything you need to do it in one convenient package! Rules, Characters, even an introductory adventure... for FREE!

The Party Pack Space Starter Kit Includes:

A streamlined set of basic rules adapted from The Victory System Core Rulebook!
Twelve (12) Full Characters... or rather, six (6) Characters presented as both male and female to suit individual players tastes
An introductory adventure
A fully-realized Villain and his minions!




Drive it around, kick the tires! This is a starter kit; be on the lookout for more Party Pack adventures using these basic characters; or pick up the Victory System Core Rulebook and make some characters of your own!

Fully compatible with The Victory System; you may want to pick up the Victory System Core Rulebook for more gear, abilities, and character advancement! You may also want a copy of the Victory System Equipment Manual to modify equipment, or to create your very own!

152404.name: Sam Hain
152404.description:
From publisher blurb:


The Reason for the Season...

The world of Hot Chicks has seen some incredible things appear. There have been demons and aliens, monsters and ninjas and robots of all kinds appearing to threaten the future and destiny of the human race. It has seen the ascension of new gods and the transformation of the old. Nothing that the world has seen, however, could have prepared anyone for who shows up on All Hallow's Eve.

He is the doorway to death and the Afterlives. He is the arbiter of karma, the passage to resurrection, and the holder of the keys that seperate the living from the underworld. Once, he was merely a mechanic of the Universe, but he was given a name. After untold thousands of years, the Earth has finally seen the arrival of Samhain.

Or "Sam," as he occaisionally likes to be called.

Bound with a body formed in the most advanced robotics laboratory in the world, the essence of Sam Hain brings the possibility of horrific destruction and terror on Halloween, his night. Of course, if something isn't done to slow him down, every night might just become Halloween.

Witness his arrival, see his incredible powers, and view the minions at his disposal. New Cyberwear, New Powers, New Psionics, and New Merits and Flaws! Includes modification packages for existing characters and NPCs so that those who have passed on can return as incredibly powerful undead, or as disembodied ghosts destined never again to touch the meterial world of the living!

152405.name: Watermelon Patch Game
152405.description:
The children's game in which players capture watermelons with a pole.

Watermelon Patch reinforced derogatory stereotypes with images of blacks stealing and eating melons.

Comes with two wooden fishing poles and many watermelon game pieces.

152407.name: Worlds Without Master (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Nov 2013)
152407.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Worlds Without Master is an adventure fiction and gaming ezine featuring sword & sorcery short fiction and games from Epidiah Ravachol and many others. An ezine that will grow in size and content as its patron horde grows in number.

This is the second issue: Volume 1, Issue 2, November 2013

152408.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 192 - Aug 1991)
152408.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #192
August 1991

Cover art by John Kingsbury.

152409.name: Jeopardy! Junior Edition
152409.description:
FROM THE BOX:
Based on the hit tv game show.

The fast-action quiz game developed just for kids! Featuring over 2000 fun and challenging questions.

Jeopardy!'s trademark is that answers must be asked in the form of a question.

152410.name: Napoleonic Scenarios
152410.description:
Scenarios for Napoleonic Miniatures gaming with any rules systems (strategic, grand tactical, or tactical) and any size miniatures.

Each scenario features:
A description of the campaign leading up to the battle
Complete order of battle
A historical description of the battle itself
Complete GM notes that provide helpful hints on running the battle, not matter the rules system used
Both historical and balanced victory conditions
A full color map of the battlefield with initial dispositions of units at the start of the battle

The book also contains numerous photographs of the battles being played

152411.name: Tricolor: Rules for Grand Tactical Level Miniature Wargames in 15mm
152411.description: Introductory level set of rules designed with 15mm miniatures representing troops of the various armies of the Napoleonic Wars c. 1800-1815

152412.name: Fire and Discipline: 1:10 Scale Rules 1740-1850
152412.description:
Miniature rules designed to simulate tactical warfare during the period 1740 - 1850. While the rules can be used for European battles, the focus is on non-European conflicts such as those which occurred in India and the America

SCALES:
One casting equals ten men but up to 13 men in some organizations
One turn equals two minutes
One inch equals ten yards with 15mm and 20mm+ castings.
One centimeter equals 5 yards with 15mm castings and 20mm+ castings.
A stand represents an infantry company, firing platoon; a cavalry troop or gun section.

152413.name: Playable Napoleonic Wargames
152413.description:
Rulebook for miniature wargaming in the Napoleonic period from about 1792 up to 1815. The particular focus is on simulating the conflict of British and French armies in Spain and Portugal between 1807 and 1814.

The book comes with a complete set of wargame rules and campaign rules, including various options and a large campaign map.

152414.name: Tattletales
152414.description:
FROM THE ARTICLE:

Based on the Goodson-Todman TV Game, Tattletales...see on Prime time Daytime T.V. and at night once a week. To play, partners must match answers to given questions. Matching of points wins the game and the dubious honor of ending a great "Tattletale".

Contains: Scoreboard, Play Money, Question Booklet, Covers, Pads, Woden Makers, Couple Tokens, and Stands, Instructions.

(NOTE: Though no home game of Tattletales was ever released to the public, Hasbro promoted a home game version in a 1978 catalog sent to its dealers. However, The company reconsidered it when the show got cancelled around the same year.)

152415.description:
Made from Stainless Steel, the dice (spinner) rings can substitute the dice of the game and are designed in a unique way where an outer smaller ring spins in a grooved inner ring that slips onto your finger.
One spinner ring is designed with roman numbers on it, the 2nd spinner Ring is designed with the Talent Icons!
152415.name: 12 Realms: Spinner Rings

152416.description:
The Crab is a Special Edition Miniature and has special gameplay.

If players are able to defeat the Dark Lord of Bone Island, a Crab with a pirate hat remains.
To help you, the Crab follows you to every Realm. The Crab offers you additional blue talents to use. Which talents you can use depends on the Dark Lord you defeat on the Bone Island.
Used talents from the Crab didn't recover. If all talents from the Crab are spent, the Crab is gone.
152416.name: 12 Realms: The Crab

152417.description:
This expansion contains 10 additional city cards with a red banner instead of yellow.
Like the normal city cards, each card of this expansion has a unique abilitly and can be mixed up with the normal city cards.

For a balanced gameplay, it is recommended that the maximum of city cards is always 23.
152417.name: 12 Realms: Bonus Town Cards

152418.name: The Chromatical Gambler
152418.description: A game intended to teach music score reading skills and music scales. In a game similar to Parcheesi/Ludo, three pawns have to move around a board comprised of chromatical scales, only using the notes belonging to one specific musical key.

152419.description:
From website:

Witch Hunt is a Tabletop card game for 1-8 players.

As a witch hunter, you make your way through the village of Ravenwicke discovering items, artifacts, and assistance in the most unexpected places. However, time is short. As ingredients are added to her cauldron, the witch gains power and tightens her grip on the village. Once all five of the ingredients have been added to the cauldron, the witch wins the game! So, it is of the utmost urgency that you find her before the last ingredient is added to her brew. Oh, and did we mention that one of you is actually the witch?

Set in the backdrop of the small village of Ravenwicke, Witch Hunt is a closed-deck (72+ cards) card game that features 3 modes of play. The Angry Mob mode for 3-8 players, a Player versus Player mode, and HERO mode for only the bravest of souls.

NOTE:

The First Edition Deck is delivered in a sealed 3.5"x5" Telescoping Box and is our core deck of 72+ cards for playing Witch Hunt. The box also contains 8 oversized character cards, 2 six-sided dice, and 100 resource tokens.

The Family Edition brings a new dimension to hunting witches. In addition to all the benefits of the Witch Hunt First Edition Deck, the Family Edition comes with a beautiful 18"x18" Village Game Board, delivered in a sealed 10"x10" Game Box. The Family Edition also includes all of the core cards, 8 oversized character cards, 2 six-sided dice, and 100 resource tokens

The Kickstarter Special Edition Bundle includes: The Pirate Expansion, The Witch Coven Expansion, 5 Special Edition Cards.
152419.name: Witch Hunt: Ravenwicke

152420.name: Pizza Express
152420.description:
The town's pizza bakers are well known for their delicious pizzas. To make sure they are freshly prepared, each pizza baker has installed a pizza oven in his delivery van. The customer receives the freshest pizza, baked hot and crispy right outside his front door.

The players are all pizza bakers with their own pizza oven express vans. The game board is a town "map" with roads, signal lights, barriers, one-way streets, supermarkets and six pizza customers.

Todays pizza customer is decided by throwing the die. A cute littel wodden house is placed on the location to identify where to deliver the pizza.
All the bakers then set off in their vans to deliver the pizza to the hungry customer. If you are the first to arrive at the customer's house, you will recieve moey for your pizza before a new customer shows up. To win the game you must be the fastes pizza baker three times.

It is a turn based game where you have two options each turn after having trown the dice: Drive in the direction of the pizza customer, or play a card.

The cards give the following possible actions:
- Switch trafic light from red to green or green to red.
- Open or close a barrier.
- Blocking a street in both directions
- Turning a steet into a one-way street.
- Move your opponent's van by the number thrown - usually in reverse.
- Request all players to visit a supermarket to stock up supplies before continuing to the customer.
- Cancel pizza order and throw the dice to decide who is the new pizza customer.

The number of cards are limited for each delivery round (3-5 depending of number of players), and not restocked untill a pizza is delivered.

A fast game about delicious pizzas and fast pizza bakers!

All parts made of wood.

152421.name: Trendy Apples to Apples Snack Pack
152421.description:
A pop-culture focused miniature edition of Apples to Apples. Playable as a standalone game or combined with the original.

Players select the card from their hand that they think is best described by the adjective card played by the judge. If the judge picks their card, they win that round.

152422.name: Football Manager 2014

videogamehonor.35516: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Nominee

152422.description:
FM14 features a revamped transfer module where opposing clubs and managers adopt a more realistic approach when making or responding to transfer offers. In addition, a number of new ‘real world’ transfer clauses have been added, such as the ability to loan a player back to the club he’s just been bought from and the option to offer a combination of cash and loan players, as well as new contract clauses such as a sub bench appearance fee. The old ‘turn-based’ system of transfer negotiations can now be done two ways, the tried and tested system and a new ‘live’ system, similar to that used in Football Manager's contract negotiations.

Interaction between players, managers, their rivals and the media has been improved. For example, members of the coaching staff now offer feedback on how reserve and youth team players are performing. Managers can also ask key players to have a word with unhappy squad members, while the introduction of an end-of-season meeting allows the manager to let the squad know how they have performed and set targets for the coming season. Contract negotiations are more realistic in the game, as managers and boards can now make demands and lay down their visions for the club in both initial job interviews and contract renewal discussions.

Managers can attempt to renegotiate transfer and wage budgets as a reward for staying loyal if they’ve been offered a job by another club, with the outcome helping to aid their decision on whether to move or not.

Source: Wikipedia, "Football Manager 2014", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

152424.description:
Looney Labs 2013 Christmas Present contains four card add-ons for four different Looney Labs games. After the initial Christmas 2013 gift release, the pack is now available for purchase in some retail locations.

Contains the Cards:
Live Woolly Mammoth (Chrononauts) - a new artifact for the game, something neat to collect.

Knock, Knock (Monster Fluxx) - a new goal for Monster Fluxx, you need the Spooky Door and Angry Mob of Villagers to win!

Fluxx or Looney Pyramids (Choose One) - It begs the question of which one would you choose: Fluxx or Looney Pyramids?

Scramble Colors (Fluxx: The Board Game) - A new Action card: "Gather up all color cards currently in use, shuffle them together, and deal them back out." It really switches things.
152424.name: Looney Labs Mammoth Fun Pack

152428.description:
Pip•Pip is a strategic board game of conversion and compromise. It is inspired in equal parts by Sudoku and Triple Triad.

There are two players, both with a handful of six-sided dice.

On each player's turn, he rolls a die and place it on a space within a 4×4 grid.

When players place a die in a space horizontally or vertically adjacent to an opponent’s die, they check the numbers on the two dice that are facing each other. If the number on the current player's die is greater, the opponent’s die is converted to the current player's color.

Players continue placing dice and converting die colors until all the spaces in the 4×4 area are filled. Once this occurs, the game is over and the players tally their scores.

The game usually comes down to the wire, with the winner achieving victory by the skin of his teeth.
152428.name: Pip•Pip

152430.name: Silly Situations
152430.description:
You've found yourself in a bit of a pickle! Can you make the most of a silly situation with a bunch of random objects? Pick up, trade, and collect object cards to create a wild and wacky story. Use all the object cards in your hand to win!

On your turn you can draw a card, pass, trade cards or tell a story with a set of three Object cards. The first player to get rid of all your cards wins.

152435.description:
Includes more armies, special rules, and clarifications/errata to Tactica.

New armies:
Armenian
Pontic
Late Roman
Early Gothic
Hun
Sassanid Persian
Late Byzantine
Ghuzz
Bulgar
Arab Empire
Lombard
Saxon
Viking
Norman
Sumerian
Mongol
Hungarian
Hsiung-Nu
Han Chinese
Early Japanese
Middle Japanese
Late Japanese

Clarifications/Errata include:
Catafract Units
Elephants
Macedonians vs Indians
Exhausted Units - The 25% Rule
152435.name: Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming – Supplement Book 1

12034.name: Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming

152436.name: Campaign Book #7: The War of Independence in the North
152436.description: Presents information on the organization of the respective armies during the war, the Orders of Battle for several actions as well as some information on flags and standards of the period

152437.name: A Wargamer's Guide to The First Crusade 1097-1099AD
152437.description:
A booklet on campaigns and battles of the medieval period, from the 5th to 15th centuries, intended to give an up to date historical account of the events and provide a beginner's guide to wargaming those events

Includes:

Concise, footnoted, historical narrative of the campaign, including sections on personalities, troops, armaments and strategic movements.
Accounts the battles of Dorylaeum, Antioch, and Ascalon, fully describing from contemporary and archaeological sources.
Chapters on wargaming the campaign and the three battles using available commercial board games and miniature rules, including appropriate army lists.
Simple painting guide




Softback; 55 pages.

152438.name: Chevy Chase
152438.description:
The Deer Stalking Game.

The board shows a deer park divided into two Chases by a high wall which has gaps through it. If a huntsman moves on to the same straight line as the stag (providing there is no obstruction of wall or rock in between) the stag is counted as dead and is removed from the board. There are five stags to bag and the winner is the huntsman who bags the largest number of stags.

The huntsmen throw the dice in turn and move along the brown dots according to the number cast. They can only move from dot to dot along the straight lines. They cannot turn corners and they must move the exact number or not at all. If a huntsman moves on to the same straight line as the stag (providing there is no obstruction of a wall or rock in between) the stag is counted as dead and becomes their trophy.

The part of the stag is played by the two huntsmen in turn as follows: a huntsman moves his own piece first then if he wishes he can move the stag either one or two dots in a straight line.

152439.name: Auf den Spuren seltener Tiere
152439.description:
In this roll-and-move game the 2-4 players are wildlife photographers, traveling around the globe to the wildlife reserves for photo shoots of endangered animals. The rarer the animal the more points the photo is worth in the end. The player with the most points wins.

The game theme is based on a popular German animal documentary TV series of the 1960s and early 1970s.

152440.description: Typical spin and move board game. Object of the game is to reach the fire and return to the starting point.
152440.name: Going to the Fire

152441.name: Bimbes
152441.description:
Objective: Be the first arriving at Berlin having successfully collected 8 million Euro (illegal money) for the upcoming elections 2002 in Germany
- acting/moving by turns -
'dark-black' satirical approach describing a world of corruption, bribery... using offshore accounts in bordering countries financing upcoming elections.

Roll & move, draw cards... making up decisions to collect and stash money, make promises and betray others...

Game reflects the political scandal about the German former chancellor Kohl.

152442.description:
"First, there was law and apparent order. But law's reach was limited. In those untouched corners, there was chaos. Chaos can be exploited, can give unimaginable rewards for those with enough courage and ability. Now rival families struggle for supremacy on the streets. I advice you to step aside, or you could find yourself in a shallow grave. You know, family matters belongs to family..."

The Orcfather is a card game based on a fantasy-themed mafia in which a player's characters can be orcs, elves, ogres, undead, dwarves and more. The players form two mafia families that are confronting one another, and each of the families elects its own "godfather" at the start of the game; the goal of the game is to eliminate the head of the rival family.

Each round starts with a planning phase in which players must secretly prepare the actions they plan to take — attack, defend, or business — but players cannot speak to one another during this phase. They must use their intuition to develop plans as a team, predicting the actions of both allies and enemies. Once all players have decided, they act in order.

While the attack and defend actions are somewhat obvious, for the business action players draw from the business deck, gaining cards that enhance their attacks, potentially save allies from complicated situations, and more.
152442.name: The Orcfather

152443.description: Finland was part of Swedish kingdom for many centuries. Finnish provincial capital city was Turku. This game is about road from Turku to Hämeenlinna. This road was called Hämeen Härkätie (Oxroad of Häme). In the game players visit 26 notable places along this particular road. If you'll happen stop in any of these locations, there might be tasks for you to accomplish. The main goal of the game is to learn local history and it's offered for schools as a tool for teaching. The basic mechanic of the game is just simple roll and move. The winner of the game is the first player to reach Hämeenlinna.
152443.name: Hämeen Härkätie

152444.description: This is educational roll and move game about Helsinki city district of Töölö. Players are rolling the dice and moving across the streets of Helsinki. There are 24 places of interest and if players happen to stumble on them, then they must answer some questions. If the player knows the right answer, he/she might get some kind of reward (extra throw of dice, get further). If the player's answer is not correct, he/she might get punished (miss a turn, go backwards). First one to finish is the winner.
152444.name: Töölö

152445.name: Level 1
152445.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Floor Plan of an Industrial Boiler Room, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

The PDF includes a 360° View of the map.

“The automated controls have gone haywire! The only way to stop a boiler explosion now is the manual release valves!”

Level 1 is a single map of a mechanical floor in the basement of a building. Level 1 can be used as the bottom level of a building with Sector 15 at the top and Level 19 as the mid-warehouse level. Level 1 includes a 360-degree panoramic view of the area.

Level 1 is intended for use in modern or near future science fiction settings.

Adventure hook for use with this product:

Manual Override: The mechanical floor includes a series of industrial boilers controlled by a remote room. The remote room suddenly is unable to control the mechanical room. At the same moment, the building goes into lockdown as if the entire building has been hacked. The boiler could explode if the group does not go down to manually override the boiler controls and release the pressure. Either they have the knowledge to do so, or they need communication equipment to contact the remote control room. The hacker will attempt to jam this communication and disrupt this way of saving the building.

Its either that or figure out a way through the doors to escape the building before it explodes!

The hacker is a former disgruntled employee of Sector 15 trying to destroy the building as revenge for being fired. It is up to the group to hunt him down by finding him from his remote location nearby after saving or escaping the building.

152446.name: Electronic Super Joy
152446.description:
User Summary

Electronic Super Joy is a challenging platform game set in a world of electronic music. The game has more than 45 levels and includes music by Envy.

152447.name: In Sickness and in Health
152447.description:
From publisher blurb:

A job offer, something about a master criminal looking for adventurers... Nothing about the Reis Confederacy is ever easy: from the strange alliances to predictable betrayals.

A NeoExodus adventure for characters level 3-10 (APLs 3 through 9).

152448.name: Silver Lining
152448.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following the failure of last year’s Crusade, many in the Caneus Empire want revenge upon the Horde while others are planning to make a name for themselves. Whatever the case, two ladies are looking for adventurers. Their plan is simple but its execution has a single flaw: between them and their goal: the Janus Horde.

A NeoExodus adventure for characters level 3-8 (APLs 3 through 7).

152449.name: El Joc de TV3
152449.description:
A trivia/party game based on TV3, Catalonia's public television. It's released to celebrate its 30th anniversary.

It has 1400 questions and challenges, all are about TV3's history.

152450.name: Tiny Thief
152450.description:
Tiny Thief is a point and click adventure game that is part of the publisher Rovio Entertainment's Rovio Stars program. It is set in the medieval period and the solving puzzles normally requires stealth.
The story of Tiny Thief follows a child-like Robin Hood, that steals from bad guys such as corrupt sheriff and mayor, pirates, and stingy bakers over six stages. The thefts are made difficult by the presence of guards because if they see you this will end the stage.
Scoring is similar to Angry Birds, with a possibility of earning up to 3 stars for each level. The first star is finding the objective, the second is finding the hidden ferret, and the last is finding all of the hidden objects.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tiny Thief", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

152451.name: Mr. One Minute Challenge
152451.description: A game from Wilkinson's self-published 'Mr.' range. The aim of One Minute Challenge is to complete five one-minute long challenges, for example naming forms of transport or types of curry, or memorising a shopping list. The game comes with a deck of cards each containing a challenge and a sand timer. A player who successfully completes a challenge keeps the challenge card, and the first player to reach the target number of cards wins.

152457.name: Lost Treasures Vol. 1
152457.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a compilation of all of the first set of Lost Treasures for Fortune's Fool.

Lost Treasures: Vaults of the Vatican, Fool's Paradise, Naughty or Nice, Pax Romana, and Serpent's Tongue Tiger's Claw are all in this PDF.

152458.name: Raid on the Blackrock Mines
152458.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a city suffering under the tyranny of a power-crazed prince, the adventurers have acquired some unwanted attention. To prove they are not a threat to the establishment, they must descend into an abandoned coal mine and eliminate the kobold tribe menacing a nearby village.

Who is their mysterious employer? Is he all he claims to be? Can he be trusted?

Aside from the obvious, what other dangers await those who dare enter the Blackrock Mines?

Raid on the Blackrock Mines is an adventure for 4 to 6 1st level characters of any alignment. It is the first in a series of adventures in and around the city of Liberion. Included within is:

A 15 page adventure with background information.
20+ pages of 1"=5' scale printable maps of every encounter location!




This module can be easily incorporated into any campaign setting.

152459.name: Railroads
152459.description:
Railroads is a train-themed, set collection card game in which players race to match cargo types with stations to collect as many points as possible.

The station cards reveal just enough information to let players know how much effort it will take to claim the card (by listing how much track is needed to reach the station). Using engine cards, players create a train, then load it with cargo cards. The first player to claim a station card flips it over to reveal which cargo is needed; if he delivers the right cargo, he scores bonus points.

As the game progresses, which stations are left and what possible cargo they will need becomes easier to deduce, resulting in competitive and quick plays toward the end of each game-playing session.

152462.name: Beer Nerd
152462.description: The Beer Nerd™ game is a beer tasting game from the creators of the Winerd® game. Taste 3 beers at the start then answer trivia questions and take blind tastes to advance. Think you know your beers? Then Put Your Beer Where Your Mouth Is!

152463.name: Battroborg
152463.description:
Battroborgs are motion controlled battling robots that are built for combat and fueled by your fists.

Players control their robots via handheld nunchuck style remotes. Robot punches correspond to each human punch and move the robot forward. A solid blow to the face scores a point and is shown via led. The first to score five points wins as their opponent becomes disabled.

152464.description: Roll and move game with a travel theme published in France (1880 - 1900). Players visit exotic locations and world Capitals. Starting and ending in France.
152464.name: Par Terre et Par Mer

152465.name: Rundfunkspiel
152465.description:
This is a simple roll-and-move game. Some spaces on the game board have special radio-themed meanings, which are explained in the game rules.

The first Player to reach space 70 wins the game.

152466.name: Crypt Crashers
152466.description:
The Crypt Crashers have found the pharaoh’s tomb and now the adventure begins!

Crypt Crashers is a highly thematic cooperative board game. Players take turns moving their heroes around the tomb to collect clues. If the heroes select the right clues, they will reveal the location of hidden treasure. As the game progresses, mummies begin to awaken and the Eye of Ray symbols are revealed. If four of these symbols show at the same time the tomb will come crashing down. So, players must shift the tiles around to keep the Eye of Ra symbols covered at all costs. Time is running out. More mummies are waking up and huge webs are a foreboding sign of things to come.

Crypt Crashers has nine levels of difficulty and 15 different expeditions. Each expedition introduces new elements to keep the game fresh and the players challenged.

152467.name: Arbakampsi
152467.description:
Blurb from Purple Duck Games store:

The Purple Storeroom is a series of tightly-focused supplements that cover topics that do not fit into our larger offerings. They are the pieces that just don't fit anywhere else or they are the little things we work on to take a break from bigger projects like Purple Mountain, Legendary Treasures, or Lands of Porphyra. They have been stored here for safe keeping.

The game of arbakampsi was invented by the zendiqi people of the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, in the lean decades after their total defeat in the New Gods Wars. It simulates the tribulations of that seesaw conflict, of seizing territory, gambling on a hunch- and taking chances that may or may not pan out. That there is a small advantage to one of the players is an accepted part of Porphyran life- nothing ever proceeds on an equal basis; to assume so is ignorant naivety.

Arbakampsi is a boardgame common to the Lands of Porphyra. In addition to the game itself the product contains three arbakampsi related feats, three magic items, and information on the game itself.

152468.name: Snowball Wars
152468.description:
Snowball Wars has simplified game mechanics and the player usually controls a team of combatants. Events occur to interrupt the regular game by way of Wildcards drawn from a deck of cards whenever the attacker and defender roll the same number during combat.

Snowball Wars is a Print and Play minigame complete with full rules, figures, terrain, bases, game tiles and game cards.

You will need a colour printer, cutting tools, glue, foamcore and time. Assembly instructions are included.
a great introduction to tactical gaming for little ones.

Nominated for the 2012 Ennies Best Miniature Product Award

152469.name: Katana Schoolgirls vs Zombie Furries
152469.description:
The objective of this game is to hunt down and destroy the monsters and collect gear. Each opponent and gear has a point cost that is added at the end of the game to determine the winner. Objectives can shift during the game depending on the game scenario you are playing and your character’s Dark Secret motivation.

Minigame complete with full rules, game tiles and game cards. This is a layered PDF giving you four options of colours and a horde of zombies. There are 94 possible miniatures in this set!

You will need a colour printer, cutting tools, glue, foamcore and time. Assembly instructions are included.

Nominated for the 2012 Ennies Best Miniature Product Award

boardgameimplementation.208655: A Song of Ice and Fief (fan expansion for Fief 1429)

208655.name: A Song of Ice and Fief (fan expansion for Fief 1429)

152470.description:
Fief: France 1429 is a game of dynastic ambition in which players assume the roles of nobles in the 15th century kingdom of France. Each player strives to become the most powerful ruling force in the kingdom by gaining control of Fief and Bishopric territories. In turn, they acquire Royal and Ecclesiastical (church) titles which give their families influence to elect the next Pope and King. Players strengthen their positions by negotiating marriage alliances between their families, setting the stage for love, treachery and deception!

Fief is a classic French-language game and is being re-introduced by Academy Games in English with updated rules, new units, a new and larger consolidated map, and more. This edition also includes additional components, which enhances game play.
The game board represents a portion of the Kingdom of France in the Middle Ages. Villages have square outlines that are connected by roads that allow Lord and Troop movement. The villages are grouped into eight colored background areas that represent individual Fiefs, which are domains given to Lords to preside over. Fiefs have different colored backgrounds and Bishoprics have heavy bordered outlines that include several different Fiefs. Each village also belongs to one of five church Bishoprics; each Bishopric is outlined with a heavy border line and is numbered between 1-5 along the edge of the board inside a Bishop's Mitre.

Each player controls up to four family members, comprised of male and female nobles. These family members will rise in power by gaining Royal and Ecclesiastic Titles.

In Fief: France 1429, a player may attempt to gain control of all the villages in a Fief to gain the Royal Title of Baron, Earl or Duke. For each Fief a player controls, he gains 1 VP. These Titled Lords may now take part in the election for the next King. They may even be a candidate to become King, thus bringing 1 VP and more power to the family! Other members of your family may follow the calling of the Church to gain the Ecclesiastical Titles of Bishop and then Cardinal. These titles allow you to Tithe Bishoprics, taking the Church's (i.e. "your") fair share of income from other Fief Lords! The highest goal your clerical family member can attain is to be elected Pope, bringing 1 VP and special privileges to your family!
You win the game as soon as you have 3 VPs. This is easier said than done and you may need to form alliances with other players through diplomacy and marriage to obtain your goal. When one of your family members marries a noble of another family, the two of you become allied. You now win the game together with 4 VPs and cannot win alone, unless your marriage is annulled by the Pope or your spouse is "mysteriously" murdered or dies of some other foul means!

In addition to being wary of your fellow players, you may draw event cards that can quickly change your destiny. Bounty Event cards are beneficial to the Player and include "Good Harvest", "Good Weather" and "Added Taxes" cards. But some cards are Disaster Cards that can randomly effect all players in specific Bishoprics. These include "The Plague", "Heavy Rain", "Famine", and "Peasant Uprisings"!

Income can be increased by players imposing church tithes on their opponent's villages or taxing their own Fiefs. Players may purchase new Fief titles, improve their village incomes with mills, and fortify their cities.

Players will also need to protect their land and castles. Men at Arms and Knights can be purchased, as well as Siege Engines. If you feel that other players are not running their Fiefs as well as you can, you may try to invade their territories! But you must risk one of your family members to lead the troops into possible battle, where they might be killed or taken prisoner. If two opposing armies are in the same village square, a Battle may be initiated. The players assess the size and strength of their armies, which determine the number of Battle Dice each may roll. Each "f" rolled is a hit. Men at Arms are defeated with one hit, while Knights require three hits to be removed from the battle.

The Kickstarter Edition of Fief: France 1429 included the Fief: France 1429 Expansions Pack and offered 3-D buildings and metal coins as 'add ons.' These items are all still available directly from Academy Games.

This game is the most recent edition of Fief. It re-implements:

Fief (first original edition, 1981)
Fief 2 (second edition with updated rules, 1989)
Fief (third edition with completely revised rules and material, 2011)
152470.name: Fief: France 1429

152471.description:
It's the roaring '20s and there's a fortune to be made steaming across the wild oceans. To succeed, you'll need a captain's steady nerve and the help of Lady Luck to land your cargo where it's needed. You have ships full of passengers and precious cargo, but can you outrun pirate robbers, terrifying storms and a stock market crash that might devalue your goods?

Manifest is a game of cargo ships, sea scoundrels, and nautical mayhem. Win points for your shipping company by completing Contracts. Pick up the required goods or passengers at their source, then navigate the high seas to deliver them to their destination. With a choice of private and public contracts and multi-purpose action cards, there are many paths to victory, and some "take that" options to make sure your opponents don't steal the limelight.

Manifest can be played in two ways: Standard and Expert. The Standard game is the introductory and family game. The Expert game builds on this, with a deck-buying and building mechanism replacing the blind card draw, thus adding another level of strategy that confident players may prefer.
152471.name: Manifest

152472.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 198 - Feb 1992)
152472.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 198
February 1992

Cover art by David Pluckett.

152473.name: Hyper Light Drifter

videogamehonor.32546: 2015 PAX Curse Award Best AI of the Year Winner

152473.description:
Explore a beautiful, vast and ruined world riddled with unknown dangers and lost technologies. Inspired by nightmares and dreams alike.

Drifters of this world are the collectors of forgotten knowledge, lost technologies and broken histories. Our Drifter is haunted by an insatiable illness, traveling further into the lands of Buried Time, steeped in blood and treasure hoping to discover a way to quiet the vicious disease. Echoes of a dark and violent past from the dead eras resonate throughout and he can't help but listen.

Hyper Light Drifter is a 2D Action RPG in the vein of the best 8-bit and 16-bit classics, with modernized mechanics and designs on a much grander scale.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgameimplementation.126423: Heavy Gear Blitz! Shields of Freedom

160835.name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide

152475.description:
Blood Debt; Peace River Army List

Originally scheduled to be released at GenCon'13, the "army list" is a new format replacing the last two unpublished Field Guides prior to Dream Pod 9's announced rules revamp sometime in late 2014 or early 2015.

Unlike the full Field Guides for the New Coalition and Allied Southern Territories the army list formatting does not contain any fluff chapters or a full vehicle compendium.

This book is available only in an electronic format.

From the back cover;

TN 1951

Peace River Army List

Includes new vehicles, datacards, how to build your army, updated combat groups and threat values plus options for the five Peace River factions:

- Peace River Defense Force (PRDF)
- Peace Officer Corps (POC)
- Home Guard Security Force (HGSF)
- Combined Task Force (CTF)
- Paxton Sponsored Badlands Militia (PSBM)

This 32 page book is an Army List for use with a copy of the most current Heavy Gear Blitz! Core Rulebook. Miniatures, six-sided dice, and a measuring tape are required for play.

For two or more players, ages 8 and up.
152475.name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Blood Debt; Peace River Army List

152476.name: Res-Q
152476.description:
From the rules:
--==--
Res-Q is a collectable card game based of amazing real rescues carried out in New Zealand, designed by a Rescue Helicopter Pilot.

A fun part of this game is simply collecting the cards of different and unusual scenarios, all of which actually happened.

There are 8 packs, each consisting of 18 different scenarios and a Miracle card and a Good Weather card. Look for an Unusual card - there's one in every 360 cards and a Very Unusual card - there's one in every 720 cards. Collect them to increase your odds of winning.

The object of Res-Q is to save the 'patient' and thereby win cards.
--==--

Each card has 2 functions:

1. Scenario
2. Equipment, vehicles and personnel

Each player in turn chooses a scenario and the other player plays equipment etc. Then the scenario card is flipped and points allocated from the played cards. If the requisite points have been reached the scenario is successfully completed. The player who is successful takes all the cards as points.

152478.name: Abalone
152478.description:
User Summary

This beautiful and functional videogame version has room for two teams of large marbles. Players take turns pushing the marbles around the board, with the goal of pushing six of the opposing player's marbles off the board. The central idea is that a column of marbles has weight given by the number of marbles in line. Someone will need to push with a heavier group of marbles in order to push the column along that axis. However, with six possible directions, it's difficult to defend yourself perfectly. Also, it's possible to play the game with up to six players when supplemental marble sets are purchased.

152480.description:
Objective: be the first ending on space 89
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game - roll the die, move forward & follow instructions printed on lid inside if you end on a marked space.

Remarks:
Belongs to series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele";
Likely published ~1920s
Movers: pewter figures
152480.name: Brockenfahrt  Eine Reise durch den schönen Harz

152481.name: The Missing of Cloud Bluff
152481.description:
user summary

Orphans have been disappearing at an unusually high rate, and the party are sent to investigate.

Could this be related to weird noises and strange goings-on around the cliffs at Cloud Bluff?

A first or second AD&D compatible adventure for a party of characters of levels 5 to 8, written as an entry for Brych Lynch's 2013 Adventure Design Contest.

152482.name: Vast & Starlit (Omnibus)
152482.description:
From publisher blurb:

A nano-game of interstellar crime and rebellion by Epidiah Ravachol.

Four game books in one, a not a single book over 470 words long!

This tiny package packs an entire cosmos of punches:

Character creation rules;
Rogue vessel creation rules;
Alien species, culture and environment creation rules;
Rules for handling long military campaigns as well as drawn-out courtships;
Rules for creating and violating alien taboos;
A full-color map of the entire galaxy;
Rules for interstellar travel and pursuit;
A complete account of the Seven Wonders of the Galaxy;
Rules for creating new and alien technology;
Calibration mechanics to make sure everyone is on the same page when it comes to the wacky, weird and powerful;
Guidelines for customizing technologies to the cultures that created them;
Customization rules for the player character’s personal gear;
And rules for building, repairing, inventing, constructing, jury rigging, and demolition on a deadline or at the sort of leisurely pace only interstellar travel can allow!




All of that, and the core game, in less than 2,000 words!

User note: this product contains the entirety of the contents (including cover images), in order, of Vast & Starlit, Bodies in the Dark, Stellar Atlas and Renegade's Technical Manual.

152484.name: Pure Steam Campaign Setting
152484.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the age of steam, coal is king.
